When the guy at the register yelled to have someone fix my coffee the guy brings me the wrong size but I was so disgusted I just came on to work.
I prefer both of those to Nero and after this morning's service it will be quite some time before I return.
My overpriced burger came extremely undercooked.
To give them credit, the models of the various satellites sent up over the years are pretty interesting to look at.
One bite of the burger and I see blood red meat!!!
Good hearty menu, good variety, big ass martinis, nice servers, good sweet potato fries, baked potato salad yum, good Reuben, awesome chicken pot pie, amazingly delicious grouper sandwich.
Competent and friendly techs who really know their stuff, and they put you at ease as much as possible.
Great food and good experience.
Beautiful plated flood and tasted great!
The people mover is a little different than the one from California.
One thing is great is the lines are always so short and the ride is relaxing.
This is one of the first rides we went on which was nice.
You get a tour of tomorrow land and get to see a preview of each of the rides which is nice.
A very nice, clean restaurant with great service.
Bottomless steak fries and root beer floats are a plus.
The burgers I found a bit lacking.
It's big, clean, and has super friendly employees.
Whether you want standard groceries, fresh food made to order, or beer & wine this place is for you!
My tavern double tasted like something I could have gotten across the street at Burger King for just a dollar or two.
Meat and fish are fresh.,..
Tables and lounge area in the front where you can eat or get work done
Bathrooms are clean and right at the front so you can stop in even if you aren't shopping!
To avoid crowds don't go Sunday NIGHT... (especially if you have a car... the parking lot turns into a war zone!)

Took my 2007 Mazda 6 here for routine maintenance.
I was impressed by competitive pricing, extraordinary customer service, & time taken to complete the work.
They provided a very nice loaner vehicle from their lot when I ended up having to leave my own.
I will definitely return here for service/repairs.
So, here I am at this really great pizza place, and I order a burger.
I ask the waiter if the burgers are any good, and he does not hesitate.
Burger it is, then.
That was one perfectly cooked, amazing burger.
The only problem is that I love Uno's pizza.
They have a great butcher with excellent cuts of meat, a decent seafood section, and a bread slicer they'll use if you ask them to slice the Iggy's bread in the bakery department.
Not a fan of the customer service desk, but the employees on the floor are very nice & helpful.
It was a beautiful night and we sat on the patio and enjoyed the view of Lake Dora.
I had pork loin over lobster Mashed potatoes which was awesome.

aspectTerm.term: pork loin over lobster Mashed potatoes

sentence.text: My husband ordered sea food paella which he really enjoyed.
Third time I have been to TEN - the service has been great and attentive.
The food is straightforward and satisfying.
Had a great lunch on the patio Saturday, and our server, Adam, was phenomenal.
The pasta special was great, and I would order it again.
The indoor space is challenging, given the configuration, but I think that it is workable and the servers help make dining there a pleasant experience.

My fiance and I stopped here for breakfast on our way out of Portland on Monday 4/8/13 at around 9:00 AM, and it was EXACTLY what I wanted: Unpretentious, simple, relaxed, great tasting, hearty vegan food.
I had the "Superhero" which was a tofu scramble with veggie sausage, tomato, and spinach.

aspectTerm.term: tofu scramble with veggie sausage, tomato, and spinach

sentence.text: It was served with potatoes, and toast.
I've had a lot of tofu in my day, and this tofu was really flavorful.
The service was super friendly, and our coffee cups never ran dry.
The interior is pretty small, and I can imagine it getting busy on a weekend morning, but Monday morning was no problem.
Another bonus: It's in a residential area, and there is ample free street parking.
Our dinner reservation was at 5:40 since we were trying to catch the 8:45 show.
The employees were honest about what did and didn't need done to my vehicle so that I didn't end up paying for unnecessary services or repairs.
For dessert we shared the Key Lime cake which we got free for "checking in".
It was a great meal and we would come back.
The interior is really nice, each room is a different art gallery dedicated to conservation.
I figured that still arriving at 6 would be plenty of time for the show but for some reason the hostess had us wait, which was strange since it was very empty.
Having been on safari in Africa I was excited by the menu as it had a lot of exotic meats.
We started with the charcuterie platter as a starter.
I went with the duo of venison which had a venison filet and boerewors (South African sausage).
My wife went with the SA lobster enhancement and the Gobi cauliflower.
The starter was very small and the vension and sausage were not bad but served cold.
I will say that the lobster was amazing and so was the Gobi.
I think the worst part of the restaurant has to be the service.
From the lackadasical hostess to the waiter which took FOREVER for dinner service unbelievably we did not make the 8:45 show.
On top of that it was one of our pricier meals that weekend.
Overall this place is definitely nice and the food isn't bad.
I think the exorbitantly long service time and price make it just Ok for me.

The Sultani, Kashk-o-Bodenjoon, and flat bread at Persepolis compare to the best Persian restaurants in Glendale, CA - and if you know anything about Glendale, CA - you know the best Persian restaurants in America live there in abundance.
The food and the portions remind me of a more traditional style and the flavors taste classic.
The prices are on point for what you get - both in quality and quantity.
I would say i was a little disappointed by the appetizer and my entree.
The other menu items are solid as family and friends have said so when we have gone out - but I personally am vouching for the Sultani, kashk, and bread.
Have been coming here for years and love the food!
It doesn't get any more authentic than this Cuban food.
Great sangria, toasted Cuban bread, empanadas, chicken and rice - so delicious!
Be careful if you order the chicken and rice, as it does have pieces of bone in it.
Awesome fries!
The fries are where it's at!
Next time I want to try their beer floats :)
The entrance is weird in that when you walk in, you're amongst the dining tables.
I understand they were full but a waiter made eye contact with me and looked away!
My server was Angela.
I finally ordered the calamari to start.
The dessert was spectacular!
I had the panna cotta which was simply heaven!
The plates are artfully assembled and pack a punch of strong, uniquely combined tastes.
My wife and I shared the Gulf Shrimp, Stuffed Pasta, and Ribeye.
The drink menu is not for those who like sweet (a good thing in my opinion).
Sipping beverages.
This review is only for the late night happy hour.
Crispy, hot, salty, and delicious fries.
Make sure to get at least a couple sauces - we got the cheddar, garlic, and mustard and couldn't decide which we liked best; they were all delicious!
The sandwich we tried - chicken satay pita, was fine but nothing to write home about.
Person who sat me then apologized about the wait time.
I had the potato gnocchi with mushrooms and I was really excited and hoped it would be amazing - It was good, but room temp when it arrived at my table.
One of the most fun aspects of this place is sitting at the low seat bar and watching the staff make the dishes, whilst of course conversing occasionally with the bartenders making the drinks.

It was a delightful experience to take in the modern, trendy decor and music generating a cool, comfortable, not pretentious atmosphere along with the dishes and drinks assembled for adults who want beautiful blows of taste in the tongue.
The brisket was too tough and the sauce was too sweet for my taste.
Also, the chips were actually French fries... not regular chips... although they have both on their menu ... so that was confusing.
Service for a big group was sub par.
The price is reasonable... $7 for fried mac and cheese, bbq pork sandwich with chips.
I had the Po boy sandwich and the strawberry shortcake.
The ONLY thing I enjoyed was the fries.
The dessert "strawberry shortcake" was a very tiny piece more like the end of a pound cake, was hard and did not taste good at all.
I tried my co workers chocolate fudge cake which was also yucky and hard, tasted like old cake.
She said it didn't have any flavor so she ask for BBQ sauce it made it taste a little better.
To top this off they didn't even cover the parking!
After stumbling into Render one day, I now have renewed faith that American's can make good coffee.
The food is pretty bland but they are gargantuan!
Great beer selection but it doesn't make up for the poor food.
Service was quick and courteous.
The food is flavourful.
Service was great!
Food was better than delicious!
The staff that work here are so nice and each dish is prepared with love.
I went with my coworkers for lunch, which wasn't as good as we wanted.
we each paid $20.50 for our meal which wasn't much...
The Po boy sandwich was more bread than anything, the fish.. Well lack of fish wasn't great, it was more breading than fish...
My co worker had the cheese burger and she was very unhappy with it.
I only drink espresso coffees and the way they prepare it is up there with the top barista's in the world is just!!
I have 3 meals from my pasta dish - it's so huge.
The only reason this place is getting two stars (instead of one) is b/c it's fair/decent mexican food for BOSTON.
Chips were cold, salsa had no kick and was runny (as in, no chunks of tomatoes or onions).
I had sangria, which I realize is not really authentic mex, but it was NOT GOOD.
For fair to middlin' mexican food, this place has some pretty steep prices (many entrees were between $15-20).
Outdoor seating, nice enough service, location, and friendly for larger groups.
Second, waited 20 minutes for food.
We ordered nachos and by the time we got them the guacamole was brown.
Also the nachos were super skimpy with barely any toppings.
Better service and you get better food for your money.
Every night they have different drink and shot specials so you can get your drink on without depleting all the jingle in your pocket.
The pizza is the same as when this place was Johny's so if you like Johny's pizza, have at it.
It was frustrating to watch so many people who arrived well after me walk away from the bar with their drinks before me.
When I brought this to the attention of the blonde female bartender that I placed my order with she told me that she had already given me my drink.
It's one thing to be given bad service but it's infuriating to be blamed for the bad service and ignored.
It seemed like a nice place but the customer service was irredeemable.
Damar, the store Manager, is wonderful to work with.
No fruit, entirely too sweet, and you couldn't see through it - sangria should be translucent, not opaque.
I fancy myself somewhat of a wing snob and had been told it would be worth overlooking the shabby interior to try the baked wings at Jacks.
I had to wait 38 minutes for a margarita - tells you about the wait time!
He communicated with me very frequently during the rental process for my wedding and made the process accurate, smooth, and free of issues.
Dinesty opened about a week ago, ambiance is simply beautiful inside.
The last and biggest offense... the prices, so damn high.
What's even better is their food was absolutely deeeelicious!
Price are very reasonable.
This place was very cheap ($12 after tax and tip during lunch time) there weren't as many seafood option as I had expected, but for $12 it was worth it.
Decent sushi roll options and lots of ice cream options even pistachio flavor (say wahhhh!!).
Loved everything about the experience - from the amazing decor including the genuine salt block 2 story pillars, the cocktails the food, and the very attentive staff.
The unlimited varieties of Moscow Mules that Russel whipped up for me kept me guessing what could be next and loving each one.
The fried beans are a must have and the steak tartar was one of the best I ever had.
Worth exploring even some of the more unique dishes in the menu including the pork stuffed squid.
The selection of smokes are good, prices fair, the service very good.
My daughter loves the French toast and the virgin coconut mojito!
Will not return because I want a little pampering and a different atmosphere when I'm giving myself the luxury of a massage.
I should have guessed I'd receive different service when I was abruptly asked at the front desk if I had a Groupon.
By the time I filled out the intake form and was on the table, it was 10 minutes past my appointment time.
I asked for a deep tissue massage, and the deep tissue part was delivered without regard for finesse.
I did feel uncomfortable, however, being called "m'lady" repeatedly by my masseuse.
Also, the last couple of minutes of my massage consisted of my masseuse grabbing handfuls of my upper traps and grinding.
Friendly staff and good food.
But the main reason is to come and eat this delicious food!
The lady giving me my 60 minute massage did not adjust for this delay (on their part), and after 50 minutes a kitchen timer went off and that was it.
If looking for exceptional food - avoid!
Sauteed veggies.
Some fresh, some from a jar - soggy, bitter tasting and flavorless peppers.
Scarce, boring flavored food.
Even the bacon could not save this place.
The coffee was surprisingly really good (I think I was used to the previous tenants) the owner said they roast there own .
The pastries/bagels/food are anything but an afterthought like you often find in coffee shops.
It was only recently that i tried the juice- FANTASTIC!
I had spinach, kale, parsley apple and lemon.
On my last visiti I witnessed an uncomfortable situation involving what looked to be a homeless man asking for lots of favors from the barista/owner (phone calls, etc).
I can tell the owner really cares about her business.
What a waste of a meal!
The dishes were flavorless and not very original.
My Veggie pizza was dry and bland.
Roast beef sandwich was uninspiring.
Pizza was very good but a bit over cooked.
Nachos not so much good.
Loud atmosphere geared to a younger crowd.
The food here was mediocre at best.
The service was good, however we were the only patrons there at the time.
The water, lemonade and Pepsi had a strange taste.
Not sure if it was the ice or the cups but all the drinks were awful.
The pizza (Margherita) was made with canned crushed tomatoes and was very bland..probably the worst pizza we've had (and we love most pizza).
The breadsticks were swimming in butter and very salty and doughy.
Overall, the food and drinks were terrible.
Their collection of rubber stamps is amazing.
You have a choice of there different TYPES of ink pads, paint brushes for just about any type of art project, and paper galore.
You cant beat the customer service.
The store front sign caught my eye as I drove by, Heo Eatery and an image of a pig.
Always down for Vietnamese food, so I dropped by later in the afternoon to try it out.
The interior is clean, modern, outlets and USB ports everywhere.
I was warmly greeted at the counter and ordered tumeric fish over rice with an ice coffee.
Food came out in about 10-15 mins, nice presentation, unfortunately the only utensils available were these flimsy plastic knife, fork, and spoons.
May have been from the overpowering flavor from the tumeric fish.
Fish was good, roasted veggies were fantastic albeit a bit oily, and the pickled veggies were excellent.
The rice was cooked with leek and garlic, that's a new one for me, I wasn't able to taste much of a difference compared to white rice.
Vietnamese ice coffee was pre mixed, very strong, you might want to let dilute itself in ice.
Had the lemongrass beef banh mi on another day and it was disappointing.
For an $8 sandwich it was pretty small.
Nothing remarkable about the lemongrass beef, the bread was standard and oven toasted, the sandwich came with a side of tater tots which was a bit strange.
Parking is limited in the front, you might have to back out into traffic, there's a lot in the back that might be the better choice.
Clean unisex bathroom, plenty of tables, good Vietnamese food.
The dining room is cleanly lined, accented with simple candles and lazy susans (!)
I had a delicious entree of steamed bass with saffron vegetables.
The fish was tender and flaky with just the right amount of saffron atop a pile of steamed and saffron infused vegetables.
He was chatty and well meaning, but couldn't answer much about the wine list or menu.
The mala pot taste was spot on and the hot pot had plenty of meat and vegetables that brought all the more memories of living in China.
Price was reasonable for the size of the pot.
It really was a hot pot for two.
The food was decent.
I had fried chicken and while it looked small it was all meat.
We also got an order of fried green tomatoes.
They have a great selection of sides.
I had mashed potatoes and mac & cheese, no complaints.
I probably would have given it 4 or 5 stars but I hate the whole cafeteria-style set-up.
Food good...upper east side, drinks delicious, nice atmosphere.
..uuumm but keep the music going during the band taking a break...
The quality of their manicures/pedicures was good.
There wasn't enough pickled carrots and daikon to balance the meat out.
The only complaint I had about the experience was the lack of training in our server.
The fried chicken was a little under-seasoned for my taste, but still pretty good.
However, the service was really disorganized.
I always found that it was essentially easier to not make an appointment because they never seemed to honor it.
E. Boston - Good food & service.
Just don't like the parking & waiting 20+ minutes when visiting.
Peabody has parking, clean, didnt wait & the food was amazing.
The waitress was AWESOME!!
I loved the empanadas and lomito.
But beware of the prices they charge for everything even a side olive oil.
Coke was 4 dollars for a can, this place has theme park prices ridiculous.
If you get there before dark, you could read the menu and order up something good.
We wanted a little dessert but could not see the menu.
Our waiter told us about them, but, if want to LOOK at the selections.
I might would go back for a really early dinner or lunch.
This review is for jewelry repair only.
Our appetizer of a charcuterie plate came with the appropriate meats, cheeses, and olives, with some onion marmalade and zesty aioli with breadsticks.
Ours included a chick pea and cinnamon mix, garlic mashed potatoes, creamed cauliflower, etc.
Like the polenta fries and the chicken saltimbucca.
They have a jeweler on staff so repairs and fittings are very quick - and surprisingly inexpensive!
I went here last week for a team lunch.
I had the "Dazed and Confused" pizza just because I wanted to try something different.
It's not on their regular menu, but it came with goat cheese, pecans, red onions, roasted brussel sprouts, dates and some other stuff.
Dates and brussel sprouts on a pizza doesn't sound great, but it worked and was delicious.
I've been here a few times for drinks and once for food, and I always leave pretty happy.
The cocktail list is great, with tons of (changing) creative and delicious drinks usually priced betwen $7.50 and $8.50 -- pretty reasonable considering the quality of cocktail.
They do seem a bit slow with drinks - but I've only been here when it's been fairly busy and ordered drinks in the dining room, I'd assume you get faster service sitting at the bar.
The food is very tasty, somewhat upscale fare.
I had the spicy clam stew and sampled some of a friend's gnocchi (prepared vegetarian by request with absolutely no drama) and both were quite good.
I will certainly make it a point to come back, sit at the bar, and sip cocktails while eating charcuterie plates and snacks with a friend or two.
Still some of the best Indian food we've ever had.
Still consistently some of the best Indian we've had across three continents and easily some of the best prices we've had as well.
I love the Vegan Nom!
Their tacos and sauces are so flavorful and unique.
We also tried the quesadilla and it was to die for.
A really perfect vegan breakfast or lunch.
Pretty tasty burgers with good options and drinks, but the typically endless line is what kills hopdoddys for me.
I don't think it is worth the wait, but still good food.
Tri Tip sandwiches are the specialty and they DO NOT DISSAPOINT.
Huge amount of steak with onions on a fresh hard roll.
Small updated bar area with good happy hour and specials during Blazers games and weekends.
I just let her finish with the new polish and was sad the rest of the time.
Tina the owner had no idea.
It took a week for me to receive my roses and they were dead.
They over night another arrangement and it look almost as bad.
The thing is, there was no line at the counter, and several tables were open.
I go up to the counter to order and the girl asked "Have you already ordered?"
If I was the owner or the manager of this place, I would be pretty angry and concerned that my staff was persuading patrons not to order at the counter.
The other sections of the ceiling are fine.
Secondly, $1 grilled cheese Mondays - overrated.
The grilled cheese has become bready and bland.
Yes, it's only a dollar and you get chips, but I'd rather just make my own bomb-ass grilled cheese at home -without the hour (or sometimes two) wait.
Music blasts, people have to scream over each other.
Draft/beer list is still superb - especially during happy hour.
I really wish they would expand the patio - perhaps open one out back the way Rumba Cafe is.
I've come here quite a few times for their Sunday jazz brunch.
It's affordable, big (so plenty of seating), laid-back ambiance and the food is pretty good and service is fast.
Brunch is my allll-time favourite meal and I wouldn't necessarily call it the 'best brunch food ever' but it's standard in terms of what you can order and I go more for the ambiance.
I usually get an eggs benedict or omelette and am always happy and full with my food.
Also, the oatmeal that comes with most of the meals is really good.
Last trip, my friend had the fried catfish and eggs which was decent.
Called customer service, and they stated they could not do anything about it - seriously?
First of all, the ceiling - crawling with dust bunnies.
And that fan circulating it around? Yep, covered in dust.
While I raved before, having gone back and had and/or attempted to enjoy the special, it's nothing to waste your time for.
Lastly, the space/size - TINY.
It'd be great if they had outdoor seating now that it's summer!
Classes are excellent.
Facilities are clean and well outfitted.
Staff is friendly and always personable.
The pool is fantastic in the summer.
The yoga room & instruction is outstanding.
I especially like that they reach out to the community offering programs that help people through every phase and stage in life.
I got to try Voodoo Doughnut for the first time, and it blew my mind!
I've been going there for years and the food is always amazing.
The olive oil, garlicy goodness on the butter with great warm bread is amazing.
The Pepita Redfish which is always on the menu Rocks!
The soup changes every day and Chef Mayes never makes the same one twice.
The tenderloin is amazing and I've never had a fish special I didn't love.
I do love spice and many dishes come with some heat, so ask if you aren't heat friendly.
I have always had wonderful, perfect service.
After taking a cooking class with Chef Mayes a few years back, my waitperson told him that a customer had attended his class.
I was entertaining guests from out of town and Chef Mayes came out with gratis desserts for us all.
There is additional parking in back.
update: Cafe Josie hosts a monthly Wine me Dine me dinner, usually 5 or 6 courses paired with wine.
Like most things in this world, auto mechanics are not binary and easily lumped into GOOD and BAD, but rather somewhere in between.

There may be less expensive options, but Paul's is close to my office, he and his staff have been extremely helpful and nice to me, they have gone out of their way to help me numerous times, and I trust them with my car completely.
During the weekday lunch rush, this place has 6 or 7 people lined up to make your sandwich and get you in and out of there FAST!
You can have a line to the door and still walk away with your food in 5 minutes.
They have online ordering and do deliveries as well.
The customer service here is definitely top notch and better than what I've seen in some restaurants.
Unlike Jennifer L., I never saw any smoked salmon or mini-pizzas, but I'm going to have to ask about that next time I'm there.
However, I did see free cookie samples for people waiting in line.
As I walked in for lunch this afternoon I sat at the bar.
I was not greeted or asked would I prefer a table or bar.
We decided on the Buffalo Chicken Nachos (fried).
The food was mediocre, they barely gave us enough chicken on the BUFFALO "CHICKEN" NACHOS and the extra 2oz cup of Queso requested was $1.29.
Aside from that the entree was very tasty.
The chips weren't soft like many nachos and very well put together .
I will mention this place is very frugal with the food and wouldn't be one of my top choices to visit again.
I live in Rhode Island and went down for Halloween in salem and this place was absolutely amazing I had a great server the margaritas were excellent and the food was even better.
Since coming back home to RI I have been craving the Pastor chimichanga I may go back to Salem just for the howling wolf
However...based on what we read, reservations were encouraged, which we made a day prior, no problem.
The thing of it is, when one makes a reservation, there is an underlying and unspoken assumption that the restaurant makes special efforts to seat the reserved party at choice seating.
There was no differentiating between walk-ins and reservations.
Our table was in the middle of the room vs the walk-in before us was seated in the last available booth/window side.
During sales the sizes are always clearly marked which makes it easier to find what I am looking for.
However, we all know that when people are rummaging through items, they sometimes place them in the wrong place so we cannot blame that on the sales associates.
The sales associates are always friendly and helpful, and even when the store is busy, they do their best to ring everyone up as quickly as possible.
Vij's Restaurant is an excellent Indian restaurant in Vancouver with exceptional service and exceptional food for an exceptional time!
When the restaurant doors opened, Vikram Vij himself, the owner of the restaurant, greeted everyone individually as they walked in.
He also would stop by our table a couple times throughout the meal to ask us what we thought of the food.
The servers stop by the table with a tray of goodies where one could just grab a piece to eat in a single bite.
One of these things they bring to the table is their chai tea which was particularly excellent.
For our entrees, we ordered a bunch of dishes which included samosas, eggplant curry, mutton kebab, and much more.
What I loved about each of their curry dishes is that the sauces are different for each one and are quite distinct from one another.
Three of the more memorable dishes for me are their lamb popsicles, portobello mushroom curry, and spicy goat curry.
The lamb is super tender and has it's signature gamey taste laid atop a pool of yellow curry which was my favorite sauce amongst all the dishes.
The portobello mushroom curry includes a thicker and creamier curry sauce with meaty and hearty mushrooms that were cooked perfectly.
The spicy goat curry was great in that.. well... unlike the other sauces, this one had a nice spicy kick to it.
I felt that this dish paired well with the mango lassi which is thick and refreshing.
By now it's no secret to the Ole Latte staff and owner that we really love their coffee.
Last summer they served me a seasonally available blueberry iced coffee that was so fresh and lovely I am still craving it.
The coffee itself is buttery, with notes of chocolate and fruit.
Todd, despite or in addition to having some of the most delicious coffee in town never underestimated us.
First, the positives: Great menu selections, excellent service, and relaxed, intimate atmosphere.
I ordered the prime rib which was excellent and my husband enjoyed the signature plate chicken and ribs.
The server was very attentive.
Ernie was my stylist.
He was very meticulous with his work, and my haircut turned out great!
I can already tell that it's one of those haircuts that will continue to look great even as it grows out.
Random Order did have free wi-fi, but thats about it.
Why have wi-fi if people can't plug in their laptops?
When I ordered my chai, I was encouraged because they asked me if I wanted spicy or sweet.
I chose the spicy chai, but what I got tasted like skim milk with vanilla and a dash of nutmeg.
I counted three fans in the store, all pointed to the counter and prep areas, rather than out to the customers.
To make up for this, I guess, they had the front door wide open.
Got the meatball and "eat your veggies"
Loved both, but especially the meatball one!
It is all kinds of crazy that my fianc is still sitting outside the establishment (because despite serving food, the place is filled with cigarette smoke) waiting for a pizza.
Very disappointed for the price.
Took the recommendation of our server and ordered the margarita.
Our drinks, food (meatloaf w/ mashed + collard greens w/bacon bits) were delivered promptly.

aspectTerm.term: food (meatloaf w/ mashed + collard greens w/bacon bits)

sentence.text: Service was excellent, not overbearing, not gone and never to return, just right place at the right time.
Great food.
The pizza is phenomenal.
Delivery is very fast.
The food is excellent!
The staff very friendly and charming!
Wish I could agree with the fellow yelpers on this one but there door and yelp page have them open till 4:30 but they had an employee standing guard at the door telling people they are closed at 3:45
We just ate an amazing meal at this restaurant.
It's menu is sort of similar to Rumi's kitchen and Zaffron, but the taste and flavors are different.
The service was excellent, and we will definitely be back!
I just read the other reviews, and yes, the parking attendant was super nice as well!
The kid's menu pizza is a great value and you can't argue with a playground to keep them entertained.
The best part of the meal was our service.
Rylee greeted us with a smile, seated us immediately and then proceeded to provide excellent service.
This restaurant is in a great little spot and they have excellent food!
I got the shrimp teriyaki for lunch and it was heavenly!
The teriyaki had the perfect spice to it and the prices were spot on as well.
This complaint is for their customer service.
However, they still charged me for the cake and the delivery, which was a day LATE anyway.
I called today to get some of the delivery fees refunded, and the employee told me they "did get my email message, but it was too late to cancel the order."
The employee then told me I would have to call the store directly to get a refund for delivery fees.
What horrible customer service.
I forgot to mention that when the cake was going to be delivered, I got a call from an unidentified person saying I was going to receive a packaged surprise that morning.
But today I actually managed to get someone on the phone who would refund the delivery fees to me, since the cake did get delivered to my recipent, even though it was woefully late.
How can you complain when Allie and manager Nicole are watching the kitchen and jumping right in when the backed-up cook staff got slammed and our meal got delayed?
Awesome customer service!
Fresh veggies layered on hot jasmine rice with a savory dressing.
All of their food is so flavorful with fresh vegetables and delicious rice!!
Dining in or carry out are great experiences!
I usually order chicken and broccoli ( boring, I know) but im always soooo happy with my choice!
Everyone we have taken there has always loved their dishes.
They are really big portions, with is good for family style or eating leftovers for a few days
For the price, this place is great!
Our waitress was very attentive to our large group, she was knowledgeable about their gluten free items, and she had no problem with me ordering the Basil Fried Rice gluten free.
Also, the manager came out and showed me what was gluten free in the buffet line: Tapioca, Tom Yum Chicken Hot & Sour soup, spring rolls, and salad.

aspectTerm.term: Tom Yum Chicken Hot & Sour soup

sentence.text: The Basil Fried Rice and the Tom Yum soup were the highlights!
Loved the name, and the location, thought it would be cool inside.
On the plus side, my haircut and dye job was very good.
The stylists walked around forever and talked while I seemed to sit there forever FREEZING.
Bathroom access- outside, and dirty.
The bad, cold atmosphere and lack of promptness left a lot to be desired.
Great classes and instructors.
It is a judgment free environment to get your fittest and enjoy your workout.
There is everything to chose from ranging from traditional cardio, to strength, to pole, silks, hoops.
The staff is friendly and energetic and is always there for you.
And it has not disappointed today I order the tacos for taco Tuesday!
You have a choice of getting chicken, catfish, and shrimp.
They were decently favored tacos.
My least favorite would have been the catfish.
However, I was still satisfied with the food and service.
Love all of the vegan options too - would love even a vegan cheese sauce please!
The multiple soups and extra-long salad bar are great.
I always try 4 or 5 of the soups on each visit.
The staff is friendly and the place is usually spotless, although their sanitation suffers a tad during busy peak times.
Fresh ingredients, crispy, light crust.
The flatbreads are good too.
The friendly service made it an enjoyable time for me.
Best tortillas I've had in a long time.
Great service and vibes!
They've got a great sushi menu too.
Whether you want fried rice, Kung Pao chicken, or a variety of sushi, this is the place to go to have it done right.
Great atmosphere, awesome equipment.
The instructors are very knowledgable and very encouraging.
Then kindly greeted by one of the nail techs, she barely spoke English and was hard to understand but very nice.
The nail tech cut my nails too short without asking and overall did an okay job but her attitude made up for it.
I ordered online delivery of a cake, but then tried to immediately cancel the order once I saw that shipping (within Cambridge, to an address only several blocks away!) was 43 dollars!!
I tried to call to cancel, but they were closed, and I filled out the online customer service request immediately to cancel - they never cancelled my order.
Edit: Forgot to mention: Pork Two Ways - crispy pork belly and juicy pork tenderloin, cooked just the way I like it.
The decor- alright, very moderate!
Out of all of them I would say that the chicken was my favorite it was seasoned the best.
Amazing happy hour menu, super friendly service, delicious cheap margaritas, great vibe - pretty much all you can ask for.
Primarily to buy a cake for a birthday occasion.
The Cappucino/Mocha cake.
The cake is delicious.
With that said, I recently visited with a friend to buy some baked goods.
I bought: Marble Coffee Cake, Madeleine, 2 Macaroons (Mocha and Green Tea), and Red Bean Pastry.
I thought macaroons were suppose to be softer, not crunchy on the exterior.
Not the best pastries in my opinion.
Soft shell crabs were perfection.
Sparkling rose a perfect pairing.
I thinking about sueing them for the pain and aggrevations of putting off my physical therapy for 3 weeks all because of their lies.
I stopped by for the cheese cake based on a friend's recommendation and I was very impressed.
The cheese cake was awesome with a drizzle of raspberries sauce over it.
If you want a great cheese cake (one of the best in Portland), GO to Bugattis.
My waitress name was Anne, ask for her as well.
She provided great service with a wonderful attitude.
I give it three stars because the venue is nice and the bar tending staff inside were nice but the door staff are completely rude, just like a lot of the other reviews say.
The Macaroons were just okay - nothing special.
The marble coffee cake was too dry, not moist at all.
The marble coffee cake was not good.
Excellent place to eat Brasilian food.
They have a great variety of food, steak, chicken, rice and beans, sandwiches, coffee, juices and an amazing bakery.
Poor and slow service.
They were out of several items on the menu.
Food quality not great.
Friends recommended the Thai Cuisine version so off we went.
First of all the entranceway where you had to wait to be seated was a mess.
People stacked up and the host came but he was so involved with a lady with a missing online order that he ignored all the people stacking up.
The Thai tea that came was awesome.
The Pad Thai that came was tasty but the noodles were a bit over cooked but not too badly done.
The rice I was hoping had redeeming features, it didn't.
Overall not too bad if you didn't want the chicken.
I wanted to try the purple rice dessert as that is my favorite Thai dessert but after eating the mess of the chicken we wanted our bill and to get out of there.
The bill all total was under$30so not too expensive but next time stick with the noodles dishes.
Small Staff - Yeah, I waited in line for a coke but they didn't start the movie until the line was gone.
Customer Service - Fine by me if the guy is reading when I come out for a refill mid movie and he finishes the paragraph he is on before helping me.
Bottom line is I got to see a fun movie with my best friends, get a soda and popcorn for about $11.
Terrible teenage chefs over cook not-so-fresh seafood.
Service was lackluster at best.
I had better food at a Red Lobster - now that's just sad isn't it
Everything was so flavorful and delicious, the fusion enhanced every aspect of what was already well-made, fresh ingredients.
The Mapo Tofu is by far our favorite, with a slight hint of spice, the tofu exploded with flavor upon being chewed, it's aftertaste lingering in your mouth, making you crave for more.
It's a small little restaurant tucked away inside the shopping center, yes, and there's been a wait to get seated every time I've visited.
It's a simple place, but efficient - and the food is delicious.
I've had both the miso ramen and the house ramen, and both are delicious.
The broth is flavorful and smooth...and definitely filling, the pork is delicious and the noodles are tasty.
An especially awesome meal for those cold, winter nights when you need something to warm you up.
Although the burgers are a little on the small side.
Everything on the menu that I've tired from the Chorizo burger (which is my favorite) to the Patron XO Shake has been extraordinary.
The servers and hostess are surprisingly very friendly.
Rooms kind of on the small side, but well taken care of and clean.
Desk staff was helpful and kind.
Great free breakfast and a really nice surprise of free dinners with beer and wine.
You have to try the brasilian Ham, egg and cheese sandwich.
We ordered Pad Thai, Kao Man Kai (steamedchicken version not the fried), a Thai Tea and water.
Kao Man Kai looked too dry, like drink my whole huge Thai Tea and another glass of water dry.
The dinner service is much better than the lunch service.
Anyway, four stars for the dinner shift.
Amazing spaghetti and meatballs.
All of the beers I tried were unique and delicious.
The bartender was nice, but the place seemed dark and sparse, kind of thrown together at the last minute.
The service was subpar but they had a great beer selection and the loaded tots were great.
Ping Pong table outside is a winner!
I started getting massages here over the winter when I was gifted a groupon.
I've never had body work done before coming here and I recommend it to anyone that talks to me about body pain.
I can't believe people are downstarring this place based on the noise.
Our waiter didn't write anything down.
More on the staff later.
All the windows/doors were open so it was a gorgeous setting and the place just had an awesome vibe.
I love the high exposed brick ceilings.
We ordered some pizze and appetizers to start.
Pizze were delicious.
The fried calamari was cooked perfectly.
Arancini were ok but the sauce they came with was fresh and delicious.
The bruschetta was very good, especially with the added fresh ricotta cheese.
Tagliatelle with rabbit, Agniolotti, gnocchi, cavatelli, steak, swordfish, and some more pizze for the kids.
I tried all of the above except gnocchi and it was delicious.
I was told the gnocchi were excellent.
For dessert all good - the tiramisu was light and not heavy, cannoli were delicious with very good filling, and the chocolate cake was divine.
Espresso was excellent, not thin like you find in many restaurants.
American coffee was just as good.
The staff here was superb.
Our waiter, I don't know his name was just excellent.
Split a pizza.
Split a pasta dish.
The room large with beautiful dividers made of wood and bubbly glass.
Lighting was romantic.
The wood chairs do not help that situation one bit.
The wine selection was pretty good - not too much in the way of entry-level choices though.
The food was great.
I had the beat salad and the halibut.
The beet salad was awesome because it had goat cheese on it... and quite frankly you can top a pile of crap with goat cheese and I'll probably like it.
The halibut was cooked to perfection.
Really a great dish for keeping it light so that I could finish it off with the dark chocolate mousse.
Did you say dark chocolate mousse?
The waiter was VERY average, and that is, in my opinion, a HUGE downer in a place like this.
I mean, I'm dropping some serious cash on dinner - please send me a waiter that has got his shit together.
They switch up the menu often, and they also do a Prix Fixe menu for $56.
Overall good experience... but I needed a better waiter and some reasonably-priced wine selections.
The owner asked us to remove this review and also offered a refund, but we felt it was more important to leave an honest review.
Let's just say that the drinks alone set the stage for a romantic prelude apres dejeuner!!
I ordered the sticky rice, the bulgogi (korean beef) and the shrimp and chicken steamed dumplings.
The sticky rice portions were two small packets -- and were a little too "tea leaf" flavored for my tastes..but, they were still very well prepared and presented.
Service was lovely, the setting had all the ambiance of a japanese water garden repleit with those huge gold fish-like koi and lovely waterfalls.
Loved this place for dimsum, authentic chinese and sushi -- great food, great atmosphere, lovely service!
Overall, it was nice to have a cleaning service, but I never full felt satisfied with the experience.
I gave feedback to the company and did receive a $29 credit, so I gave the service one last shot but experienced the same issues.
The company makes it difficult to cancel your services entirely.
If you need to cancel entirely, you need to call their customer service line and deep in the options you can get a hold of someone to actually talk to.
I was delighted to see they have an entire vegetarian menu.
Then, at the end, was exactly what I needed: a vegetarian combo with all the choices above included.
The serving size is huge.
Service is courteous and helpful, and the ambience is quiet and leisurely.
We have done delivery from Haru a half dozen or so times now, and we love it.
The food IS good, I just thought the space and the service was sort of lacking.

They charge over $9 for a taco meal (2 shitty tacos and refried beans with rice) and a large drink and the annoyed employee working the counter said she "couldn't give me a refill" i should have just gone to a different chain in the airport.
The double baked almond croissant was amazing!!!
I waited 20mins for it to come out fresh from the oven.
They also have a variety of chocolates, pastries, cakes and savories!
The gift boxes looks nice n'fancy!
Staff was nice!
Called to make an appointment.
The receptionist (guy) was polite enough.
Great owner hosting interesting shows and the place has character up the yin yang.
Never had the food but it does have a small meu.
The first time we went, we got the same thing and it came with a few veggies.
Keep in mind that that's literally the price as a bowl of pho with beef.
Also, we ordered a cup of iced tea, and got a cup of lemon flavoured water.
This is the best Greek food I've had in Austin.
Prices are fair, and the staff was very helpful and patient.
The owner even gave us a plate of the Greek Beignets on the House because we said we wanted to try them.
The entire place is really kid friendly, and there is outdoor seating in case you maybe want to bring a dog.
The staff is always friendly, the coffee great and strong, and the sandwiches and soups are well made and flavorful.
The noise levels can vary from normal conversation to very quiet, depending upon where you sit, but except for the busiest of days, there's rarely a wait to find a place to settle down.
I do wish they had some more variety in their baked goods, or perhaps just a few more cookies.
The fries here are okay.
I wasn't a huge fan of Pommes Frites or Belgian style fries, I didn't think there was much difference between them or regular french fries.
It seems like they're trying really hard to be this dive-ish, hipster-y kind of place but the fries are kind of forgettable.
I just got back from the best facial ever.
Unprofessional, not service oriented, low class, over-priced for low quality service, and their business model is very bad.
First of all, their receptionist Jordan is very rude and disrespectful.
The owner, not sure her name, doesn't understand anything about business and customer service.
They said no, they have to have it before I get there, and they wanted my credit card number to pay for the services I already paid for with my groupon?
I cancelled the appointment and got my groupon refund, but wanted to share with world that this place is not worth your time and money.
Also, when I was there the first time in January, it was the worst massage I've ever gotten...so shame on me for coming back, but I learned my lesson.
My Daddy treated me for lunch and he loves this place.
3 stars altogether, would have been 4 but it was AWFUL service, even though the food was pretty decent.
My burger was nicely homemade, and the beer was cold.
However, the waitress was horrible.
Oh but we got our drinks real quick.
I raised my hand and smiled to another waitress, but she ignored me, I'm sure because it wasn't her table.
I just don't have the tolerance for poor service anymore.
Think of it as a neighborhood restaurant that happens to serve pizza.
First, you won't be disappointed by the pretty good pizza.
Second, you'll see the other things on the menu including burgers, pasta, and sandwiches.
For the record, I highly recommend the pasta with marinara sauce and grilled chicken.
As an appetizer, I highly recommend the Mangia Fries which are battered before cooking.
I think they're among the better fries in town.
The service at this location also excels.
Our waitress kept drinks refilled, delivered our order promptly, and was friendly without hovering.
Good beer selection, relaxed atmosphere, outdoor seating - there's no reason our visit couldn't have been the reason for a five-star review.
I prefer seasoned steak fries in canola oil.
Also the lobster taco's were just ok. Our server Adam was the best.
We got the Croquetas, Papa La Reina, Yucca Fries, Ropa la Vieja, and Ropa de Pollo.
Not all items were amazing (frankly the Yucca Fries left much to be desired.
Seriously, what the hell was that dipping sauce?
The steak tips are tender and melt in your mouth.
I recently enjoyed the delicate baby lamb chops that had amazing flavor.
My friend had the fish special and loved it.
Their portions are generous, presentation superb, and the side dishes are very good.
There are so many dishes on the menu that I want to try like the pork chops and vinegar peppers.
Update June 2018: The lobster diabolo was enough to share.
I ordered the sauce on the less spicy side and was perfect.
I substituted the pasta for veggies.
The lobster included 3 big shrimp, calamari, clams, and mussels!
The sauce was so flavorful.
This was a special and I wish it was on the daily menu.
My husband had the ribeye with fresh grilled veggies.
Dixie Crossroads has the best clam chowder I've ever had in Florida.
The Royal Red Shrimp, Lobster, and Snow Crab were all delicious.
The only thing I wasn't a fan of were the scallops.
I'm not the type of dude to complain and cause a fuss, but our server noticed that I didn't touch the scallops.
The owner came over, apologized, asked me what I didn't like about them, and offered to bring me something else or to take them off the bill.
Waiter was knowledgeable about the wine/beer/food, but didn't get me a refill on the coffee when he gave everyone else one.
Dim Sum - dim YUM!!!
The scorpion that we shared (or really, two) were just right for a lazy afternoon meal.
The Handy Pros were usually late, sometimes came unprepared with supplies and used mine instead,and one walked off with some of my cleaning supplies.
One Pro brought her daughter to my apartment with her and while it wasn't a big deal, it was definitely awkward -- her mom even had her help clean at one point.
The Kao Man Kai was tasteless, sigh.
Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because it kills me every month when the money comes out of my account - the prices are steep!
The only thing we shared all night was dinner at this place - so that must have made us all sick.

Loved the moist dumplings and the slightly sweet bulgogi, My beau had the california rolls (best flavor I've had recently,) roasted duck dim sum plate (crispy and nice salty flavor) and fried squid (lightly fried and tender.)
(I couldn't finish) There's plenty injera, but if you need more, you need only ask.
very affordable sliding scale price.
That decision is that I am bearish on dine-in, and bullish on takeout.
:)) Tried their crispy chocolate raspberry cake.
Definitely sounds like the receptionist capable of being a douche bag but he was informative.
The service is just OK, We got a vegetarian pho bowl and the bowl came with just noodles.
About a year ago, they pared down their menu to stick to local ingredients and they honestly haven't suffered at all for it.
We sat there for at least 15 minutes before the waitress even looked at us to take our order.
FYI, the garlic breadsticks they serve with the pasta are reason alone to order pasta.
Except for one: a bartender who barely acknowledges customers and just generally seems to hate the job.
The Pub Burger was fantastic.
The truffle fries were just ok with me - nothing good.
I truly appreciate any business that operates the way Dixie Crossroads does, and I'll be going back to enjoy more clam chowder the next time I'm in Titusville.
Overall: great food, good service and phenomenal management.
Came here with 3 friends (for a party of 4) on a Saturday night for happy hour.
It is BUSY, so expect to wait, as the happy hour is only available in the bar area on the right of the hostess table.
If you venture to the left, it's a full price menu.
The food is terrific, especially for the price.
I ordered the skirt steak skewers, and they were delicious!
My husband chose the Oba burger, and he devoured that thing (it's surprisingly large for a happy hour burger).
I also ordered a Prickly Pear Mojito, which was a little on the sweet side, but still refreshing and well sized.
I really appreciate the speed that food came out, and the fact that our waitress gave us a happy hour last call.
I'd definitely come back again for happy hour!
Spicy migas had a green chili holliadaise sauce that was tasty and rich.
The hash browns also had spice that made them different from traditional fare.
The food was flavorful.
Service was great.
The environment is modern diner with barstool service.
Great for breakfast and lunch.
Customized pasta is $8, and a glass of house wine is $4.
Generous portion in terms of ingredients and the cheese is freshly grated too!
Staffs are friendly and filled with young customers.
When I goto Sichuan restaurant I must try dry fried chicken.
The bags that you pay for when you first enter the orchard are reasonable.
My mom got a 20 lb bag and got well over 50 apples in it.
I got the combination plate to taste a bit of everything, but it failed miserably.
Tried 3 nights in a row to order a pizza to our hotel.
That store had a 2 hour wait on delivery.
Good sea food.
They have amazing melt-in-mouth scallion pancakes.
We loved their spicy dishes.
I wish the staff was more friendly.
Lavender latte - such a treat.
Love this place for lunch or brunch!
Went in to check for vegan options.
The ghost burger was awesome.
I love flavorful hot sauces!

I was given bulbs that were not exactly like the one I had but they said it was the one even though the contacts were shorter.The first ones did not fit and the second ones blew out immediately when I replaced them.
I asked for a refund and it was not honored because "they couldn't resell the bulbs. "
I went to a real lighting store and they provided me with the correct bulbs that work!!

I had a wonderful vegan treat here, it was a slice of blackberry cheesecake and it took longer to decide what I was going to have (they have a wide range of vegan and organic deserts and savory treats to take or eat at their mini cafe) than to eat it!

The Daily Grind is nestled on the "other side" of SE Hawthorne, and it keeps it feeling like a hidden gem, but with such an amazing produce selection, and yummy home baked goodies I don't think that it'll be hidden too much longer.
Daito features handcrafted soba noodles, dashi with both heart AND soul and totally impeccable, 4-star service.
My Kitsune udon was beautiful, simple but complex, and totally memorable.
I'll dream of this broth when I'm back in Seattle, and my city is no slouch in the udon department.
They have great service and amazing quality food.
Their pad Thai with chicken is so delicious.
Be sure to make a reservation if you're going with a bigger group.
Excellent bouillabaisse , huge salads, light healthy fare in addition to their famous chicken and waffles.
Friendly staff.
The pad thai is pretty bland.
The curry is OK.
The soups are substandard.
We stopped here for drinks just because it "looked cute" and I'm so happy we did!
I have no clue how the food is but these drinks are unbelievable!!
The marg was deeeelish and the red sonya tastes like a spicy pink lemonade.
Our waitress Teagan was absolutely amazing!!
I made eye contact with our waitress (the one who told us to sit anywhere so she knew we were wanting to eat there) at least 3 times and still she never came out for AT LEAST 5 minutes.
My husband is a huge queso fan so he devoured that.
we both ordered the Chicago burrito recommended from fellow yelpers and they did not disappoint!
The food was THAT good.
Fast, friendly and reasonable prices through my autobody shop.
One of the best sushi experiences I've ever had.
I also ordered an Ebi sunomono.
Food was fantastic.
Regular customers can also take advantage of their value massage packages.
The menu seems to have a wide variety of foods from the simple rice and noodle dishes to the more elaborate like braise lamb hot pot.
The ambience seem nice with the tasteful decor, with good comfortable seating that is not too crowded.
Our server seemed very rushed to take our order after we sat down (at 11am just when they opened).
It took almost 35 minutes until our first dish showed up which seem an eternity when one is hungry for brunch.
When the food dishes showed up at last, we were very disappointed at every dish.
The hand shredded chicken was more of cut-up pieces of chicken with little taste and too many pieces of skin thrown in.
The 7-flavour deep-fried squid tasted bland -- I tasted salty which is just one flavour as I tried to find more flavour.
The fried noodles looked good but lacked anything special (including taste!).
The sauteed shrimps were not well de-veined so tasted bitter.
We all thought what could possibly go wrong with mapo tofu rice?
Well, the mapo sauce was definitely from a jar so that was pretty hard to mess up, but the rice was too hard (tasted like rice left in a refrigerator overnight).
Very disappointed at the food at Lucky Plus!
To add to the poor service and bad quality food, we were presented with the same dishes we had already eaten 3 times over!
If the food quality was better we might have taken up their offer!
But we were honestly not interested in more of the same bad dishes.
We hope that Lucky Plus is just testing their kitchen process to make improvements and honing their waiting service to provide a more enjoyable experience for their customers.
Small pizza that was 4 pieces was 13 dollars it was too muck did not even fill me up.
Food was good tough.
This review isn't about the food, which is still pretty good.
But their policy of not giving out receipts unless you ask for them hits a sore spot.
The food at this place was good.
I ordered the red waffles and fried chicken it was good with the strawberry syrup but there definitely should've been more chicken.
The service was kind of horrible/slow.
The waiters made promises they couldn't keep such as the bottomless mimosas time slots.
We enjoyed a half off bottle of wine as well as a melon mule.
It's a very refreshing drink!
We ordered so much food and everything was amazing.
The white truffle macaroni was perfectly cooked and nice and creamy.
I'm not a huge seafood person but the Jumbo Lump Crab & Artichoke Dip is to die for!
Wonderful charcuterie and cheese plate.
Prosciutto & Fig flatbread was awesome.
We probably sat and drank wine and ate for almost 3 hours.
We had great service the entire time and never felt rushed.
Cost on pricey side.
Biggest downside is the lack of parking.
We'd go back (been twice now), however the parking situation is user-hostile for those coming into the city for an evening, even midweek.
I'm not vegetarian but love their stuff (all vegetarian or can be made vegan)- the Blair Stanley is my current favourite.
I usually add hot sauce at home though, the hot option is not that hot FYI.
Our server was awesome and such a sweetheart.
The choice between potato cakes and grits is an absolute tough one as they are both tasty.
I was happy with this simple choice since my side of grits paired well with the perfectly crisp bacon.
My girlfriend ordered the Veggie Pesto which was a breakfast creation neither of us have ever tasted.
She claims it was the "best breakfast" she's ever had!
The self-serve coffee was a hit for us since it was a cool, damp Portland kind of day.
We'll have to come here for lunch and drinks next time as we observed some pretty sweet concoctions coming from behind the bar.
The food is traditional Irish.
Decent beer on tap.
I love the curry fries.
I haven't had a bad meal here yet.
I'm not a huge fan of when they have live music since the place is a bit small, but to each his/her own.
They have an impressive selection of beers & wine.
I selected the red sangria (I'm off beer for the month of Jan).
I found the sangria exceptionally refreshing.
The staff is amazing, and more importantly, they know what they're talking about when it comes to all things beer & cider.
I called to order a pizza for delivery and they just said no.
I'm certain the food is delicious.
Unfortunately, despite the open tables, they wanted to sit me at the communal table, squeezed in the middle tightly amongst 5 other people.
I would have understood if there were not so many tables open.
Chicken was raw.
Brisket was dry and tough.
Staff had no remedy.
Service was slow, and the appies (the food) was not worth it.
Food portions were tiny, to us.
Had to buy more appies, as we were hungry.
Got the impression that the servers were pushing us to buy alcohol.

I was lucky enough that the table I was "stalking" didn't seem to mind (after I asked them of course), and even let me sit with them while they waited for their credit card to come back from the waitress.
I really enjoyed the pimento cheese hush puppies - it was a pleasant surprise and delicious.
Nice big servings and every bit is better than the last!
It's expensive considering it's takeout.
I was a bit blown away with all the great reviews but alas, Vancouver has set the bar very low for comparison when it comes to Thai food.
I would get takeout and then doctor up the food at home with fresh limes and extra spices.
After we got menus and drinks everything went smooth from there-We used yelps check in deal to get free chips, salsa and queso!
Added bonus- we got a little guacamole too!
Food is OK, but not great.
I was partial to the guacamole so we were both happy with that.
I ordered mine with shredded chicken and my husband ordered the al pastor(pork) we were in HEAVEN!!!
They also have a caddy of different hot sauces that we poured all over our burritos!
After the other tables left our server was way more attentive so maybe she was just overwhelmed and the food was so good we left very happy.
Try it, just maybe sit inside so you get service a little faster.

The combination of deep tissue massage and traditional Chinese massage has greatly help with alleviating the tension in my problem areas to the point that when I walk out of the spa I am pain free I usually go in for a 90 min massage.
If you're looking for a place to jam some hip-hop music, smoke hookah, and enjoy bottomless mimosas this is the place.
Other than that It was a cool spot to jam out and eat brunch.
Taste & presentation were very nice.
The thing I love most about the place is the quaint, quirky design of it.
We,two people, had $30 worth of appes and drinks in the lounge section because of the beautiful ambiance.
Alright, after my last experience, and Luke T.'s constant ranting, I have to up this place one star, not just for the pizza, but for the experience too.
Somehow, at that late hour of the night, the server was in good spirits, on point, and efficient.
We grabbed a table and ordered our food, with drinks following promptly.
If you like Greek food, this is not the place to get it.
The atmosphere is casual comfortable elegance with warm colors and dark woods.
You can chose to dine at the bar/lounge area, the dining room or in the outdoor garden area during summer season.
They have a full bar and a wine list.
Sunday brunch is excellent but be sure you very hungry as it is three courses.
It is great place for a date, casual conversation, drinks, dessert, or a special occassion.
All the waitstaff, host, and bartenders are very professional and polite.
Keep in mind a average dinner is about $75.00 a person.
Food is always average, service is always mediocre, and prices depend on what you order.
I had a 6 oz (i believe) fillet steak, and it was good.
I had quesadillas and they were terrible.
The lounge area is nice
Service was great, but food was a bit over-priced and I didn't really think it was worth it in the end.
Absolutely horrible service from the hostess and we'll never come back.
After waiting for a while for a table, the hostess asked if we'd be willing to give our table to a group with a wheel chair.
Hire a hostess who's not a freaking idiot.
The manicure was mediocre.
The polish on my toes is why I will not return.
Horrible job on nails and even worse customer service.
This place is over priced for horrible work.

It used to be a pretty good spot, and I used to go for the pescado burrito (even if there were often bones in it), but recently the quality has gone down and I'm not sure but it seems like the price as gone up.
I just had the barbacoa burrito and it tasted more like brisket, cost 650 and was all of about 10 oz of food.
Even the sangria has lost its flavor - which was really the only other reason to go there.
Finally authentic juicy, greasy tacos!
Just so happens that we were going to the barber, and the wait time was 20 minutes.
It took a while to get our tacos but the place was busy.
We got our tacos to-go, individually wrapped.
Cabezza and asada were amazing!!!
The cabezza was juicy and soft, while the asada was crunchy and savory!
Their tortillas are oily and perfect in size!
Just ordered a bunless burger and thought it was good.
Pricey since it was 10 bucks for just burger.
Food was tasty--and servings ample.
My husband had steak and I had chicken.
His food was a little skimpier than mine, but still an adequate portion.
Also, the crew worked quickly and were friendly as the went about their tasks.
Tables and the floor were being cleaned as customers left.
Just beware that the menu is limited, fairly basic pub fare, but about 50% more expensive that your normal pub fare.
On a side note: why do servers ask how you want your burger cooked if that's just going to be ignored anyway?
It was certainly interesting, but the food wasn't great.
The service was alright, but the waiter was extremely bland and quiet.
It was strange for the atmosphere where I expected someone to be at least slightly jubliant.
Again back to the food, there seemed to be a lot to choose from, but nothing that seemed especially appetizing.
I actually ended up getting the Ahi Tuna appetizer because it was the only thing I wanted and supplemented the rest of the meal with alcohol.
Others had the mac & cheese and were indifferent about the "pasta and cheese-ish sauce" as they described it.
My son (8 yrs. old) hates getting this hair cut.
I didn't like the parking at night it was scary walking out alone no security or anything!!

My family ordered scallion pancakes, soup dumplings, pork and cabbage dumplings, braised pork belly sandwiches (which I advise to get) and the butter miso noodles, which I think are really good to get if you have kids.
I didn't love the soup dumplings but my mom liked them a lot.
Also, the scallion pancakes were a little too crispy.
However, the service was really nice and it's cool how you can order at a counter and sit down at a table.
I was so offended by the staff here.
Best service I have ever had.
Devin our server was very attentive.
Food was just OK.
Ended up getting a refund on the last meal.
No apologies, like we should have expected the poor service.
Food was below average at best.
Cold buns and fries on the burgers.
Slight amounts of chicken on the quesadillas.
Service was ho hum...
When I got my hair cut here, it turned out great - it's pricey though.
Although hair cut is a bit pricey, I would come back again.
And on top of her great cut, she also made good conversation.
Had the spicy tonkotsu.
Ramen itself was one of the better ones I've had in Austin but...-3 stars for dishonesty of the waitress.
The new menu is limited with many of best items gone.
Prices went up, portions down.
Great place and great customer service burgers are are always juicy not much more I can ask for...great job guys
Awesome food, quick service, polite, very clean had the chicken enchiladas excellent.
Tomato basil to die for.
I like the sandwiches and burgers here but the service has not been good.
Seating is normal and not very crowded between 11:30AM and 1PM.
The dumplings with beef were particularly bland, but beef dumplings always are and I don't know why anyone makes them.
The host and our server were both extremely nice, but not terribly adept at dealing with anything beyond seating people and bringing them menus and food.
The ramen is good, not great, and nothing to make a special trip for.
The noodles are good.
The broth is okay, but there's not enough.
Good cider on tap, though, and friendly service.
been here a few times now, mostly for drinks, every time I've had great bartenders and even when they're busy, they are pretty good with getting to you in a timely manner.
food has even good too.. maybe typical tourist spot, but a good place to venture to if you're entertaining guest.
Great food and service.
Beef Milanese and Duck Breast were outstanding.
Baked Brie appetizer needed to bake a bit longer.
Reasonably prices for what you get
My previous oil change here, the guy drove over a curb while pulling my car around and broke my plastic hubcap (which came off and I had to go find).
The jackass tech forgot to put it back on.
Liked: the menu was awesome, lots of vegetarian options.
The hollandaise sauce was pretty good.
The potatoes were good.
Disliked: employees seemed kind of bummed.
Next, the Bloody Mary was veryyyy veryyyy strong, too much for me.
The vodka was soo over powering and upset my empty stomach.
Lastly the eggs were totally over done.
Nevertheless, I had high hopes for this place and was looking forward to the food.
The shrimp dumpling was huge- big piece of shrimp with lots of flavor.
Beef ball was only ok, very bland.
Chicken feet was very good- big portion and cooked so tender.
The egg white scallop fried rice was a little on the dry side but still very good.
Service was less than stellar to say the least.
They always have great fresh food and large helpings for a great price.
They serve different main dishes through the week so it is good to go a few days to see the variety or just ask them.
They have great fresh brewed sweet tea to go with the meal!
The desserts are pretty awesome too.
One of the things that I really like is you can see them prepping and making the food right in front of you.
I only got the Mediterranean salad - not great.
The dressing was way to acidic (all lemon not much oil).
And my salad had only one kalamata olive that still was not pitted.
Nice decor.
Tabouli was pretty tasty.
They charged me over $850 to get my service maintenance and the breaks replaced... labor itself was over $500... talk about ripping off customers.
The employees do not care about customer service AT ALL.
Do you not know what customer service is?!?!??
Prices are one the higher side.
The room we got was much older and dated than the one in the pictures.
And the check in process was 45mins!!
We found ants in the kitchen and bathroom, they sent pest control, we get back and the ants were still there.
The room was directly from the 80's, the worst decorated room I have ever paid $200 per night.
They moved us to a different room the exchange process took 3 hours.
Obviously not if you let someone walk out with such a horrible pedicure.
The only thing that could have been better was the server could have his hair tied back/up more than it was.
I ordered the $18 burger figuring that it couldn't be that bad - well I was wrong.
So while I didn't point it out at the time, and I know that's a bit unfair, I will say that in general it's not great food, it's subpar food, at a high price point.
Also it smelled like urine out there the service could have been better
Wait time is horrible: took way too long to receive our food, then it was brought out bit by bit.
It took a good 30 minutes for our party to completely receive our food.
Bbq sandwich had a strange taste - not in a good way
The waitress even dropped off our check before I could order another drink and we were sitting in the bar/lounge area.
Their daily specials are good but it includes only 4 or 5 fries instead of a full serving of fries.
Food: 3/10 stars.
Three of us split the big dumpling platter and most of it was fine, rest wasn't.
Service: 3/10 stars.
The pork is tender but too smoky.
The egg didn't even have any yolk come out when I cut it - too overcooked.
Food is fairly mediocre and not worth your buck.
At one point we were waiting on the street for 45mins for the bellman who was getting new keys.
When checking out they miscalculated our discount and we had another 20mins wait till the manager finally resolved the issue.
Pizza hut is great in USA, its a different menu this prices are really cheap.
Great luxury and friendly staff!
I love the luxury setting and the comfort it allows you to splurge on!
I thought this was one of the worst pizza I've ever had.
The Caesar salad was fresh.
We pretty much all left our pizzas.
I also noticed others who left most of their pizza.
Try the Nutella milkshake!
And all the burgers are wonderful... Sweet potato fries too..
So this burger was the second meal I had when I moved back to Atlanta.
I didn't know anything about the hype around this burger when I ate it, but wow oh wow was it disappointingly bad after I heard people praising.
For starters, the fries that came with it, nothing special, but the 'ketchup sauce' that came with it was ridiculous.
The burger itself was overdone and just a mess.
Best pedicure ever!
Food was delicious, specifically the tagliatelle pasta dish.
Service was excellent- our waitress, Missy, recommended a great bottle of wine to go with our meals.
I was expecting more considering the chef is a contestant on top chef.
Had a salad for appetizer which was good- it was just a green salad.
For entree I got fried chicken which came with mashed potatoes and green beans.
The sides were good but the chicken lacked seasoning.
I skipped dessert.
The food was very good, but was not cheap.
The Italian beef was also bland.
Very disappointing in the food.
The service was terrible also.
They are also a pleasure to work with when catering for lunches or dinners.
The 4 vegetable pizza was the favorite among our group, after that the 4 cheese.
They also have sandwiches and salads, if you want to eat a bit lighter.
Fair prices too.
They are getting worse and worse every time we go .the service is almost nonexistent, the food was so bad I could not even eat it .how do u ruin soup?
My husband was finished eating and ready to go when they finaly brought my soup ,it was not even eatable .it tasted horrible ,like burnt milk with uncooked dough balls .
The server was not even decently presentable.the greeter or hostess could not even speek English.
And don't even get me started on the bathroom.
And they are telling u that u can have only two breadsticks !!
I got the M&M cookie (I know this may be slightly childish, but hey I know they are good and they looked pretty big and tasty).
The cookie was just OK.
My friend ordered the 7-layer bar and a chocolate chip cookie.
The chocolate chip was the same as mine and the bar was just "meh."
The bar tasted too generic and store bought, not homemade.
I know this place is known for their cupcakes and the cakes.
They only had a couple cupcakes available (maybe 6?)
I went in on a Sunday with Friends for drinks.
Unfortunately, the tall muscular bartender ignored me and my older friends for at least 10 minutes at the bar as we waived $20's in the air.
An older bartender at the end of the bar finally was nice enough to serve us.
Bread was dry and burnt, there wasn't much cheese at all.
First of all, this is a beer drinker's heaven, the beer selection is huge and quite impressive.
The food was very good too, just not a huge selection, hence why I only give it 4 stars.
It's basically just small plates, salads, sandwiches and a few other things.
The service was good, despite it being busy.
The food is priced fairly.
I really liked the location too!
Both cocktails weren't as hot as expected.
The food was overpriced for the quality and size of what you get.
The escargot was not as good as I would expect it to be.
Spinach dip was pretty good but not worth the price.
Overall two small average appetizers and two decent drinks rang us up at nearly $60 before tip.
If the prices were lower I would've given a better rating but the value is terrible.
Terrible service, horrible wait time, Food avg.
nothing special, Chilaquiles were good though, Would not return :(
YOU WILL WAIT 2 HOURS FOR FOOD....... HORRIBLE WAIT TIME
Went to Cala bar with my husband,the service was slow(only about 10 customers inside at the time ), the manager was rude when I spoke to her about my food being raw.
Mind you it took about an hour to get my meal and to send it out raw ..
They need new management or train the one that's there.
The two star is for the pizza is really good there.
But the low score is for the rest of the menu it is horrible please dont have dinner there.
My food was horrible i had a bite never touched again.
Nice waitress was nice but would not be coming back unless i want pizza.
Very unhappy with the haircut.
Stylist fresh out of school, unqualified.
For a $40 haircut, I expect competence from the stylist, and on this day I didn't get it.
The exterior might leave a lot to be desired but this place is a solid dive/late night grub spot.
They also have a fun pinball selection.
Price- felt a little pricy still not a complaint.
Service was below average.
The customer service sucks...
The services and the network are great but the employees there have no respect what so ever.
Small portion or giant plates? The food quantity is too low
Bad service and low quality food.
Food quality was really bad.
Noise in the place was way to loud for any kind if conversation.
Had to send my food back and have them take it off the check.
In summary, atmosphere too loud, prices too expensive, bad service, food really really aweful.
Bad Service.
Average overpriced sushi.
The waitress rushed us and pretty much tossed our food on the table as she ran by.
My Husband's meal came out about 25 minutes before my sushi.
We didn't have napkins or a silverware and had to ask several times.
Service was awful food bad and poor quality.

Finally, after 5 minutes, the greedy server came around to take our drink order, some of us order iced water, some coke, and sprite, and my son order a lemonade, which after 3 minutes, she told us they where out of.
She offered him either a coke or sprite, which he rejected, and asked instead for a glass with iced water.

I don't know if you agree with me, but why should you tip that much for service that was bad, and when the server doesn't do a good job according to your expectations and in turn tries to push items that increase your check, so that she can pump up her 20% tip that she didn't deserve.
There is always a line of at least 7 people, and, despite usually having at least two people on staff all the time they will never put more than one person dealing with customers.
They have an incredibly unhurried approach to service, even when the line is snaking out of the door.
One pizza had too much sauce, the other hardly any at all.
Both pizzas were overly doughy and thick, a really disappointing experience at much too high a price.
We went here for lunch yesterday & i cannot put into words how awful our service was.
Waiting over an hour for a bowl of soup and a crab burger.
Not to mention the waitress asked us if we wanted refills on our drinks 20 mins before we received our meal.
Management should really take control of this place, if you cannot handle the amount of quests that you have in the restaurant.
Their wings are tiny.
The service is snail-like.
(Does it really take 55 minutes to deep fry some sh*tty chicken?
