Our waiter had 8 LARGE tables all by himself- he was actually very nice and trying his a** off.
The manager in charge was grossly unqualified to do any type of damage control.
This place is not even packed and it took 30 min to be seated and is now taking another 15 min to get a server.
Fried tomatoes was beyond salty; felt my blood pressure increasing with each bite.
Waiter didn't bring any napkins till 15 min after the food came out.
FOOD AND SERVICE HORRIBLE!!!
Stopped by for a margarita with a few friends.
Service was terrible.
Went to the bar for clarification about a friends drink order and was shocked at how rude the bartender was.
Good customer service may have over shadowed some of this.
Negatives: rude regular waitress and cash only.
Great food, terrible service.
I worked in the restaurant business for many years and I have never seen such ridiculous service.
I went to dinner with a friend and we ordered a full size appetizer and medium pizza, intending to bring leftovers home to our families.
The server tried to tell us not to order so much and made fun of us when the food arrived!
We also needed our check split and our server was m.i.a., so I asked the woman at the counter who was not doing anything, her attitude could not have been worse.
We felt like we were an inconvenience to our server, as he was busy talking to other employees.
There was no Wi-Fi.
No water, only terrible coffee to drink.
The bathroom was dirty.
Also, the bartender was pretty terrible, see below.
Terrible customer service.
We thought there must be some mistake because of how little meat there was, but they refused to fix the issue when kindly addressed.
The woman claimed, "The chef doesn't make mistakes."
There is a reason the dining room is usually so empty, this place will be closed soon no doubt.
I walked in for an office visit for some vision problems, and when I walked up to the desk to check in, the receptionist didn't even look at me or say "Hello."
Then, the optometrist that saw me had absolutely no bedside manner.
The bathroom is a bit dirty though... there are cobwebs in all corners and peeling paint which contrasts the cleanliness of the rest of the restaurant.
First the entrance makes no sense.. Before you get to the hostess table, there's a room.
The service was among the worst.
The absolute worst service I have ever received.
For a high classy theater, this server is not trained to provide a delightful customer experience yet one that is obnoxious and undermining.
The amenities aren't amazing but they aren't terrible.
But the staff is the worst.
After 6 months of the management saying they would fix it, our lease ended and we left.
One of my fav places for lunch or dinner in the back bay.
Not too pricy always great food and good service.
LOVE the hot and cold chicken salad.
Great salad and sandwich selection.
Worth the long wait!
For a restaurant to charge the prices they do you would think they would do better than that.
The real kicker for me was the fact that the manager never came by one time to check on our table after we had sent a steak back twice.
The pizza is too bready and saucy with very little cheese.
I thought the chicken was kind of bland.
The food may seem a little pricey for the pizza itself, but once you factor in the restaurant's ethos (pay and benefits for employees, quality sourced ingredients) it is worth it!
Delicious pizza, fresh meats for sandwiches, (fantastic Italian in particular) and fast, friendly service.
the server was slower then anything
no working sinks ,broken ,pluged up toilets ,flooding ,and smell .everyone one of them .what is with that?
the service, and food, and conditions just get worse.
3 hours to get one bowl of endless soup and salad, bread sticks, that is uneatable is ridiculous.
So after waiting 45 min for wings - wings were okay they served me raw salmon and then told me only the chef can determine if it's raw ... no ma'am I am eating it , if I say it's raw then it's raw.
I believe they could do so much better the restaurant has potential but they need a better chef.
Price was not excessive but more than it should have been for the result (less than average food)
Burnt and tasteless food.
Dirty, messy table, greedy female server.

Dumplings were delicious, eggroll tasted like frozen food boxed one, sweet and sour pork was crappy, crispy beef was great, walnut shrimp was ok, about a B+, chowmein and fried rice were lousy, flavorless and warm, not hot as they should.
We received our food and finished eating - still no refills by the waitress.
The new location needs better service and more training!
They served less than 1/4 a cup of mostly-inedible beef-gristle, soggy "fried" rice, and a soggy egg roll for $9 dollars.
Instead, our waitress offered us a free dessert.
In the end, we paid for a steak and potatoes we didn't eat and we will never go back there again.
Poor customer service!
The appetizer dressing was way too sweet, but the panang curry was delicioso!
I would've wished for a little spicier food options, though.
The prices were incredibly reasonable, too -- it only cost $15 for two people.
The Gyro was pretty good.
The meat to veggie ratio in the gyro was meat heavy but pretty well balanced, the lettuce mostly fell off while eating it(as it should).
The tzatziki was thick and tasty, the veggies were fresh.
THE FRIES THO.
I could eat all these fries forever.
I would go back just for the fries.
Review applies ONLY TO TAKEOUT!
I have never dined in so can't comment on dine-in.
The quality is pretty good, they give large portions, and have never screwed up an order.
Pricing is reasonable and they have good combo options.
It's nice that the veggie fried rice doesn't have egg as my wife has an allergy and it's annoying to ask every place!
Overall good Chinese food and our goto place for Friday/Saturday night takeout!
There were a few people who the bartenders knew by name sitting at the bar, and they were pretty friendly to us, who had never been there before.
The bartender let me try a beer I wasn't familiar with and was very eager to help me make a beer selection- I'm sure it helped that the bar was pretty slow at that point.
Outside garden seemed cute!
We popped in to meet, then set up a half day trial to make sure Chance would be a fit.
The price is also very affordable, the location is easy to get to, and every staff member I've met has been great.
Dark and cozy inside with great food.
The lobster tacos are amazing!
The prices aren't too bad either, since you can get appetizers that can function as small dinners (if you're not too hungry) for under $15.
Skip the guacamole, unless you don't mind paying 1.95$ for nothing
The salad and bread is awesome.
Although my out of town guests thought their food was not so hot.
Fried plantains not so good.
I've always had good service except for the last time.
We had to grab a waitress to take our drink order.
I guess the only time to get good service is when its slow.
All the rentals were clean and in great working order.
Ocoee Diner does have some righteous, creamy grits.
Now I ordered sunny side up because I figure it is the easiest to cook right.
I like their patty sausage seasonings.
May give their pancakes a try some time soon.
Food amazing, delivery is bad.
I keep coming back because the food is really good.
Feasted on raw oysters and fried clam strips.
Beer list was solid.
Nice outside seating on the second floor for a good view of the harbor.
Best omelet I've ever had!
It was on the seasonal menu and boy did it taste fresh and local.
Delicious ingredients put together with thought.
I want to give a quick review for the service.
Thanks to Yelp I found Code 10, who not only had several delicious looking items on their dessert menu and could be ordered directly though Yelp, but their service was great!
As the delivery man, Jose, called to tell us he was at the door, my friend revealed he was at another address!
I can't speak for the food, but I can say the treats did seem to cheer him up!
Another excellent local coffee house serving excellent coffee in a cool funky atmosphere, well as cool as you can get in a strip mall.
best pizza and roast sausage and lamb in all new england.
Their special rolls are amazing and my favourite part is that their rolls can come wrapped in soy paper rather than nori/seaweed.
A third of the outdoor tables were available and no other customers were waiting .
Please try Amsterdam Atlanta instead where we were given kind and attentive service .
The pizza is made fresh so it can take a little time for them to make and bake it, but it's well worth it.
This pizza is amazing!
Perfect pizza!
The pizza makes up for the confusion though.
Once you find a seat and a menu, It is very good.
All of our beers (4 total) cost us about $24, which isn't too bad as the beers were pretty good!
The coffee is pretty good too and served in a mug that won't go 1/2 empty if they can help it.
Sorry to say half of the egg whites was, well still clear - not a good sunny side up.
The bisket and gravey was served room temperature but mixed in with the hot patty sausage it made it down the old pie hole.
Treated extremely rudely by wait staff and hostess and the manager who seemed intimidated by her staff and left after being unable to get seated.
This is our absolutely favorite place to shop for decorations on a dime.
Great service from the moment we stepped in the restaurant up until we left!
Mixed grilled meats, steak tips, shrimp and veggie enchiladas - all delicious.
Up until tonight, i had only been here for drinks and apps.
I will come back for dinner again.
Most of my friends who have beautiful hair have said nothing but positive things about Van Michael salon so I was very excited when I needed to get a haircut and finally made an appointment.
I met my stylist and she was very nice, but the haircut she gave wasn't so nice.
So, PLEASE, Van Michael- have your stylists confirm when they think a dramatic cut is about to happen.
We ate here for happy hour which I highly recommend.
Good quality food at a reasonable cost.
I had the small chicken and dumplings, my wife had the fish and chips and our friend who lives in the couve but grew up in Louisiana had the fried tomatoes.
My chicken and dumplings were a 5/5.
The fish and chips and fried tomatoes were 4/5.
I opted to rate this 5/5 because in this price range, this is really good food and value.
It is clean and pretty nice on the inside and the food, drinks and service are pretty good too.

The menu is not huge, it's a little bit of a drive and it doesn't look like much from the outside, but if you are looking for a place to get some really good comfort food without the high cost and attitude, this is it.
I had the spaghetti alla carbonara for lunch today and it was a delicious, authentic rendition.
The pasta was fresh which does make a big difference.
Came in on Sunday for lunch and it was packed.
Their parking in the back is cramped and always full.
We got a table pretty fast, but did not get a menu or tea until we were able to wave someone down 10 minutes later.
Most of our food came in a decent amount of time but we had to chase them down for a bowl of wontons and a drink we ordered.
I felt like I could not enjoy my meal because I was constantly looking to make eye contact with a server.
When we were finally ready to get the bill we asked 3 different servers for it, but they all forgot to bring it to us.
Food is decent, but probably wouldn't come back.
They experience little to no turnover so our second time around with our son, we were dealing with all of the same teachers.
Our kids still ask us at least once a week if they can go back and visit their teachers!
The hostess is complete moron.
Me and my kids walked in and the hostesses told us we had to wait 25 minutes.
Food was good.
Service was abysmal.
So when I arrived and Jazmine made me feel totally relaxed as she checked me in and got me on the table, it was exactly what I needed.
Jazmine is a real therapist.
By the end of the massage I felt completely relaxed and I even felt taller!
They even have free parking in the back!
The dryer is slow and doesn't get hot enough.
Washer did a decent job, just don't jam it or over stuff it.
Pleasant staff? Check.
Amazing rangoons and a huge selection of Asian cuisines.
The food is really good here.
The only reason I am giving it 4 stars is the weird entry way and the just average atmosphere.
Next time we are going to try the BBQ.
I get cold cuts here every week.
Their sandwiches are absolutely delicious.
The pasta dinners are pretty good, though not my favorite thing here.
If you're ever in the area and looking for somewhere to grab some lunch, you'll be well advised to go to Bob's.
Went on a Thursday evening with a buddy for dinner, whilst visiting the greater Columbus area.
We were seated right away, and I was pleased to see a quality beer selection, including numerous Ohio breweries.
I had two different beers while there, and both were good.
The value for price is really good.
The chicken and dumplings could have a little more chicken, but the dumplings were awesome.
The service was great.
I said okay, but then after looking around there were empty tables EVERYWHERE - why did the hostesses ask us to wait then?
I asked why we couldn't sit at one of those tables and they said those tables and whole sections were closed.
Customer service as bad as it can get!
They need new hostesses - the existing ones aren't up to the mark.
Had to ask 4 WAITERS FOR SOY SAUCE TO GO WITH OUR SUSHI!
We had crab Rangoon and they were nice sized.
The veggies were cooked perfectly!
My meal was the blackened tilapia sandwich with fries, and it was plenty tasty and hit the spot.
The fries were good, but not that great.
Service wasn't that fine overall, and the prices are reasonable.
We sat in a very comfortable booth in the corner of the room.
Drinks were great, while we waiting for the rest of our party.
The menu is quite good, and has many wonderful dishes.
I started with the Rabbit Tagliatelle.
I had seared Breast, Leg Confit and a Taro Risotto with Duck Proscuitto and a Mango Mustard Jus.

aspectTerm.term: Taro Risotto with Duck Proscuitto and a Mango Mustard Jus

sentence.text: The breast meat was a little to well done for me, i like it very rare, like all of my meats, but the leg confit was awesome, very tasty, tender and melt in your mouth goodness.
Two other fellow diners had the tuna which was just fantastic, very well prepared and full of flavor.
I was pleasantly surprised by my meal at 33, and would go back very soon...
However, I don't like the ice cream consistency after the toppings are mixed in.
If I could put the ice cream into the freezer for a 10 minutes to harden a bit, that might solve the issue.
The gimmick of mixing in the toppings in front of me isn't working.
The store itself gets 5 stars, but I had to knock it down one due to the parking situation.
LOVE that there is actually a parking lot for the patrons, as it is way better than nothing at all, but it is pure chaos anytime I go!
When they first opened, there seemed to be attendants directing traffic a bit, but now it is a free for all.
Their prepared foods are amazing.
Lots of variety between the salad bar, hot bar and other various stations.
My fave is their mac and cheese (regular or buffalo), Peruvian-rubbed chicken wings and their Indian food.
Have also tried the pizza and it was very good, too.
For work, we have ordered sub platters from this location and they are always nice and fresh.
Despite this store always being quite busy, the check-out lines are efficient and the cashiers are always super pleasant.
Love this place....great staff, strong drinks (depending on the bartender) and fun place for an afternoon cocktail or a night out on the town.
Horror stories of high-pressure salespeople, botched deliveries and poor return policies added to the anxiety.
Ever changing styles from evening attire to lounge wear to everyday must haves.
Gorgeous accessories and gift items for all occasions.
The Staff is incredible, friendly with extensive fashion know how.
The staff was extremely warm, friendly and accommodating, it was like visiting grandma.
They have a great selection of wine and beer and AMAZING pizza with a lot of great and unexpected choices for toppings, which is a dream come true since it's so hard to find good pizza in this city.
It has a cozy interior with decor that's hip but not too hip, and a good amount of seating with tables just the right size and none of them crammed too close to each other.
Beautiful restaurant with wonderful staff.
The charcuterie plate was amazing.
The waitress Meghan is absolutely wonderful and the bar manager Rob is also wonderful.
If you want a great cosmopolitan please go here.
And if you want good food come here!
Sometime we start at the outside bar, have a drink and dine inside.
This is the most laid back place in town with really good food.
You can't beat the location and the patio bar at sunset beats anything Key West can offer.
Service is always consistently good, drinks are great and the food is innovative and tasty.
Pollo de la casa was delicious and the margaritas were large.
Prices are super reasonable.
The staff managed to serve us quite well without too much stress.
The cocktails were yummy and very cheep at 7-$8.
The food menu was also reasonably priced.
The dumplings were delicious, however could have been hotter.
I'll put that to the lack of wait staff.
The pork bao were nice but not amazing, the chewy meat with the chewy bun wasn't a great mix.
And not enough salad.
The fried chicken was a disappointment, the batter was too thick and oily.
But the chicken itself was nice.
All up the meal was okay and at the prices you can't complain.
But if you're after a decent meal for a cheap price and cheap drinks then this is a good choice.
I, however, love the Boloco burritos.
I love that you can get a "regular" burrito and it doesn't make you feel like you just ate all of Mexico and you have to go back to the office in a food coma.
I love that you can get a burrito with tofu in it.
I love that the staff is incredibly friendly and that actually got a personal response when I wrote an email with a complaint (they were testing out paper wrappers.
I love the clean and convenient location.
And I love...oh I love...the Jimmy Carter smoothie.
Atmosphere was great.
But chairs are uncomfortable--very hard.
However, the larger table was still empty when I left.
The wine recommendation was good.
However, in spite of the anchovies and shaved Parmesan cheese, the Caesar salad was tasteless.
The bread was very disappointing.
My main course, scialatiella, pasta with mixed seafood with cherry tomatoes was also just OK.

aspectTerm.term: pasta with mixed seafood with cherry tomatoes

sentence.text: Myers and Chang has been on my list of restaurants to go to for awhile, but because of the hard-to-get-to location, I didn't get there until last Saturday.
My friend and I ordered the mussels, fish tacos, pork lettuce wraps, and a steak and shrimp noodle dish.
Everything was good, but the mussels and pork lettuce wraps really stood out as being exceptional.
I can't remember what my cocktail was, but it wasn't very memorable, so maybe I ordered wrong.
Overall, I enjoyed my meal at Myers and Chang and will go back when I am in Boston again.
OK, Here's the positives...Absolutely the most efficient check-in I've ever had!
Very courteous clerks, housekeeping, bellboys, etc.
Room service(housekeeping) very prompt.
Beautifully decorated spacious room with a gorgeous view of the lake and a very nice screened-in lanai.
Wonderful in-suite Jacuzzi.
Grounds are manicured and very clean.
Walls are very thin and also a lot of ambient noise from outside our front door.
NO free Wi-Fi, costs $40 per week for access.
$5.00 per day usage fee for the exercise room.
Business center is a joke, no Wi-Fi enabled printer or scanner, kiosk software that makes it virtually impossible to print an email attachment.
Flavorful, fresh, authentic, artful, delicious Greek food, served up by friendly people who are actually Greek, in a cute, sunny, homey atmosphere.
Evidently they've been in their current location for almost 12 years, but changed their name and did a major re-branding 3 years ago.
Overall, the space is amazing - the rear atrium and greenhouse really must be seen to be believed.
Cartez got it all sorted out and gave me the best haircut I've ever had.
Be ready to wait a little before getting a table or ordering.
Their chicken is pretty good and spicy enough.
I highly recommend the pecan chocolate pie!
got the French toast, yum!
beef/egg sandwich is good too per se.

eggy cake got slightly soggy this time due to sitting in the bag too long before it was eaten, but the flavor is still there and interestingly, i could still get a bit of a crunch underneath the softness.
ordered hot lemon tea to go with the breakfast; was slightly on the bitter side - can't remember if the tea bag was left in or just the kind of brew they use.
well, i mean, food is pretty good too of course!
Amazing Mexican food and pretty authentic.
The Cali Burrito is a must try as is the tres taco platter.
If you are going for lunch plan on going early or late as there is a line out the door and no seating around the usual 12pm lunch rush.
Most of the sandwiches were sold out (30min before closure..) so I decided to order chicken buffalo sandwich!
It is a nice place to visit for lunch though.
Dalit is thorough, gentle, professional, and caring, and the atmosphere in the clinic is very relaxing.
we ordered a sirloin , fish and chips, Daddy's Painkiller and a Daddy O Margarita that was lip smackin' good!
The room was clean, but VERY small.
The toilet in our room had a flusher that didn't work properly.
We stay here 3 days and they still hadn't replaced our shampoo until I asked - then of course we got 3 bottles on our last day.
The hotel restaurant (Grille) was not very good in terms of food or service, and in terms of ambiance, is just a load sports bar.
We went in for a birthday dinner.
I made reservations and we were seated immediately, but the wait staff did not come to our table for a good 15 min.
Brought us water - another few minutes - then asked if we wanted to order anything.
The menu is super short and the appetizers or 'snacks' are all quite strange and didn't seem to be shareable from the description.
Drink/beer/wine menu also seemed to be short.
I will say the food was good.
Small portions for the price but it was quite tasty.
My advice is this: good meetup for drinks only, or head over as a secondary spot for dinner only.
Authentic Irish experience, and the duck couldn't get any better.
Good vibes from friendly people in an awesome city.
The decor has stayed the same, while the name and menu has changed.
The one thing that thankfully has not changed has been the food quality.
The food has always been well prepared, tastes fresh, and tastes delicious.
Our most recent visit started off rough but our waiter made up for it and proved excellent service.
This place by far has the best breakfast sandwich!
The shop location is sketchy,I'm not gonna lie...but the sandwich is so worth coming here...the only thing that sux is it closes early sometimes even @ 2pm.
But definitely a got to spot if you're craving a breakfast sandwich :)
This is not a place you go for great service.
it's more of a cheers kinda feel.
it's the place you go every Friday night with your friends for the best pizza in Columbus.
They had a very extensive wine menu, and we ended with a nice desert wine.
Sometimes we eat something snacky at the outside bar, sometime we eat outside on the patio.
We got the pork on fried dumplings, Korean fried chicken, and the ina spicy pork bao.
The paper wrapper were horrible and they have since gone back to the easy to peel foil.
Typical Italian restaurant bread is crusty, hot and cut thick.
This was the total opposite, bread was cold and like pieces of a packaged loaf - not how it should be!
The chocolate terrine was delicious.
Lovely pool area - a short walk from our room with a nice beverage/snack bar right there.
NOW the Negatives.... Appliances are old and noisy and cabinets are dated and worn.
The only negative point would be the wait time but the waiters are really nice.
The chicken buffalo sandwich was decent but it tasted like a generic 12-15 cad sandwich at a fancy bar.
The sandwich at Meat&Bread was around 8-9cad so i think cost performance wise, it is good.
I would be happy with the quality if i ate this at a bar... However as a sandwich specialist place, I expected more.
The service is fantastic, the decor is great and my maragarita - well not that great.
NONE of the basic hotel niceties were provided.
in addition bonus points for all kinds of niceness: high-quality free water (thus no hard sell on the bottled water), generous tasting cups, pleasant decor, nice staff.
Wife and I had chili dog, smokeshack burger, fries, abita root beer and Apple Pie!
The clams and mussels were too tiny, the shrimp had been cut in small pieces - takes the taste out.
you'll want the smokin joes crust.
My fiance and I love getting Riverside Pizza on the days we don't feel like cooking.
The price is good for a sumptuous meal, and the drive-thru is very convenient.
I usually take about 10-12 minutes to get my order hot and fresh, and I almost always order a side of (yummy) breadsticks and marinara sauce.
In all, this is a very affordable place with some delicious pizzas.
Prices are hard to beat and it is in a central location.
Also, the store is kept as clean as can be, but the dull smell of a liquor store is omnipresent.
The atmosphere is delightful.
The rice was flavourful & cooked to perfection.
The curry was the best I've had in Orlando.
This restaurant served very authentic and delicious Greek food, as well as great Tiramisu.
Everytime I go I try to have something different but lately keep having the smoked salmon "burger" which is awesome.
The fries are to die for with the smoked mayo (I wish I could make that at home) the burgers are a perfect size, they have a full bar and the place is cool looking.
The only negative is when you order a shake it takes for freaking EVER!!
3 times my food got to my table before the shake did!
Decent food at reasonable prices.
Ambiance is odd though.
Very knowledgable staff.
Thank you for the amazing service!
I'm not an expert in the authentic Chinese food field, but I would eat their pan fried pork buns (Shanghai style) every day.
Gone to their Happy hour twice once by myself and then with wife.
They have about 6 items for 5 dollars for happy hour.
Drink wise they had two 5 dollar cocktails and beer and wine discounted.
Service was fast.
Server was attentive and friendly.
They were fairly busy both time i went with though there were tables available.
Tried collard greens for the first time ever in life and they were amazing.
Punjab Palace is approximately a 3 minute walk from my apartment and it's some of the best Indian food I've had (aside from my best friend's mom's home cooking...mmmmm!).
The service is always very friendly and prompt, and the food is fresh and tasty.
Tikka Masala is the best!
Also love their saag paneer.
The one thing I didn't enjoy was the shrimp curry - the shrimp was tough and the sauce was incredibly fishy.
Pasta Primavera with chicken was pretty good.
Please don't charge another $2.25 for a kids drink on top of $6 for just noodles on the kids menu.
We won't be back if it cost us $30 to feed our 3 kids noodles and a coke!
I want to love this place- the lobsters sliders were perfection (pls bring them back!).
Drinks are good - somewhat below standard, but okay.
What I wish they could improve upon is the service.
The servers were always polite, but completely inattentive.
I've been there half a dozen times and have had to get up and find my server at least three times... not great.
Most pain free brow wax I've ever had and Lexie was wonderfully understanding with my pickiness in getting all the little hard to see white hairs!
Every time I've been here I try to veer away from the fish tacos that I love so much to try different things but always sneakily order a couple halibut or pescado tacos anyway.
However, I must say that the Chile Rellano is really delicious as was the Ceviche.
My husband's new favorite is the Crab Enchilidas which came out piping hot.
Service is still friendly and I'm happy to see that business has picked up since the last few times we've been here.
Although our order took awhile to get to us (it was so busy that the exec chef/owner had to take our orders) I can definitely say that Fonda Rosa is worth the wait!
I just got a manicure and it was minimal.
The overall look of the place was dirty and I wouldn't want to get my toes done here because it looked uncomfortable and not that clean.
Clean bathrooms, lots of parking available.
About 5-6 food options including one inside the connected gas station.
Stopped here for Lunch and sat at the bar.
Service was outstanding.
Ordered the daily special of shishito peppers the second I heard it was on the menu.
They were cooked perfectly and even came with a tortilla sauce on the side which was fantastic.
If you're looking for a place for a drink (and some tasty food to go with it), or you just want to hang out and eat with friends after work then this may be a good place for you.
I came here with four friends in the evening, and we found a tight but comfortable table.
I ordered the $12 bibimbap, which came shortly after a bit of conversation.
My friends ordered the Japanese pork cutlets with a separate bowl of rice, which looked crispy and fresh from the fryer.
I mixed my bibimbap and it was quite good!
I also want to mention that the rice was very tasty and purple.
The service was decent as they were quite busy, but as long as we made eye contact and waved them down they took care of our orders quickly.
The restaurant had clean washrooms, a cozy and causal ambiance, and a noise level that was neither too loud nor too soft.
My favorite place to go for ramen.
Really great broth and noodles but gets packed really fast and it's s small place so seating can be limited.
It is because they service me really quick and short.
Came here for a friend's birthday dinner about a month ago and had a pretty good dining experience.
Also tried their star attraction main plate, the vegetable paella, which was phenomenal.
:) Sangria was also good and the service was decent.
Our waiters were very helpful and attentive to us throughout.
Would definitely come here again, both for the food (definitely want to try more of their small plates) and the decor!
First time here, and it was during happy hour.
Uptown has quite possibly the best Happy Hour menu I've ever seen, filled with healthy portions of upscale gourmet selections.
The happy hour items aren't scaled down versions of the real meal; they are the real meal, just for super cheap!
I had a wonderful burger with grilled onions and mushrooms, that came with a mound of seasoned potatoes.
Beer selection is very good, and the happy hour prices takes another buck off the pint.
The bar also appeared to have a nice selection of liquor, if you're into cocktails.
The service was excellent, with professional, friendly, and attentive staff.
Great atmosphere; like a dark old lounge where your grandfather may have hung out when he was young.
Huge number of pool tables (it is called Uptown Billiards).
Food was great!
Service was outstanding!
Our son has a peanut allergy and the chef came to our table to ensure that what he ordered was prepared safe.
Great sports bar atmosphere but has enough local flare to remind you that you're not at home.
Recently enjoyed a family feast at Comfort and all were pleased with the food, drink, service and venue overall.
The meats are prepared to perfection and creatively paired with tasty sides.
Just amazing food!
We got the prosciutto pizza and mushroom risotto!
Great service, the lady we had was so sweet and attentive!
Great beer on draft!
Although the name of the dishes were unfamiliar, the taste was down home yumminess.
The short ribs and potatoes were so good, the gomen(collards) were tangy and scrumptious.
The service was quick, efficient, and polite.
Sometimes the wait is pretty long and not worth it, but if you're lucky you can find a spot at the bar to sit and eat and drink at.
The crab cakes are really tasty and the cocktails are refreshing.
It was a nice relaxed night with the smell of beer all around.
I didn't even get a chance to go upstairs(that's where the pool tables, 10 pin, and lounge are) because we got there sort of late and I didn't really want to leave the arcade.
The food is usually good and this time was no different.
It is disappointing to see that they have now added a tea fee.
Checked in Saturday morning at 9 am, and was so surprised to find that my room was ready for me.
That was a huge perk to be able to go to the room directly after my flight and freshen up before heading out.
The room was very clean, with an excellent view.
Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly.
Shrimp cocktail were nice portion.
Especially enjoyed the dipping sauce.
Dressed Maine lobster changed my husbands perspective on lobster all together.
Not much for raw seafood so the bartender suggested the steamed clams which neither me or my husband had previously had, very similar to steamed mussels.
Looking around at other selections people had the pan roasted lobster, and swordfish are the next on my list of items to try.
Awesome foods, but parking is a little dicey.
Based on a Yelp review, I had the pork tenderloin medallions and am glad I did.
I went in and asked the service person before handing my car off and he sampled a little spot and said that it'll look a lot better because they're going to use a machine to buff it out.
I have not eaten here, but I have come in for drinks on various occasions and since my last visit i decided to add a review.
The entire design of the bar was horribly added into the space provided.
It takes way too long to get a drink in here and you constantly have people on top of one another trying to get one.
Then a big table is situated right in front of the bar, which limits people from getting to the bar.
These are just some of the issues with the layout.
My wife was smart and saw the featured item was Korean BBQ Ribs.
Nearly boneless, very tender, very tasty; and, hardly Korean, the ribs served two of us!
Our daughter had vegetable fried rice; and, enjoyed it greatly.
We had a great time sitting outside, enjoying the food; and, looking forward to the Rivers of Light Experience soon after supper.
The food was worse than low-end pre-frozen microwaved diner food.
Otherwise, steer clear and don't believe anyone who tells you this place is great, and you *have* to try the fries.
However, the only thing that crossed my mind was that prices were kind of higher for some of the items.
Tried the crab cakes and french fry.
I tried the Lebron cocktail.
Also tried the potato salad ...it wasn't my favorite...bland.
However...THE BIG WAYNE delicious!!
From the outside it looked nice but the interior isn't nice at all...not sure why people are saying it is.
Lobster Roll was perfect with a side of slaw and fries.
I had the Patatas Bravas and Blistered Shishito Peppers which were both cooked and seasoned perfectly, and were absolutely delicious.
My friends had the pizzas ... which is actually a whole pizza ... and was also delicious.
The arcade was not as big as I had been expecting, but there was still plenty in it to keep me busy...and I beat my two friends in the car racing game (so obviously I will like it).
Overall a very enjoyable experience, only down side was price was a bit high, but I would certainly return.
In my opinion it gets way too crowded in there, especially near the bar.
I had a crispy egg roll, which was nice; and, we all split the fries that came with the ribs
I love the atmosphere of the clinic - it is very relaxing and cozy.
The OJ was outstanding and worth the wait.
The food was perfectly cooked and seasoned good portion size.
If I could change one thing it would be to make the indoor seating area a little quieter and that's definitely not a dealbreaker.
Great people, food and of course great vibe.
Then they had the ticket windows operating extra, super slow.
That addes 45 minutes to the wait.
Other than the wait time it is the same fun.
As mentioned by other reviewers, their food is "OK", but not great.
If you're expecting a Snarfs or even a Quiznos, you'll be disappointed.
Also they have recently repainted with brighter colors, but it still gives off an "institutional" vibe - they should hang some photos or add some real decorations.
Great, I tipped an extra buck and looked forward to my sandwich on nice crispy panini bread on this cold winter day.
The order-delivery person said they could re-make it but my co-workers already had their food and I didn't want to wait yet another ten minutes.

I'm sorry, that's called capitalism - the appropriate response is to improve the quality of your food so that you can compete for that business, not ask the government to ban competition and leave you with a weak product.
I moved East earlier this year, and I recently discovered that I can get delivery from Green Basil!
Their web site is a little ambiguous about it, but they definitely do deliver and the food is every bit as good as in the restaurant.
As a Chinese guy, I should say taste of this restaurant's hotpot is boring.
Truly the best selection of beer in the Boston area, and the folks that work here are knowledgeable, friendly and FUN.
Let me start with the fact that the classes I have attended here are great.
I'm disappointed in the business side of btone, although the classes with most teachers are great.
It's probably one of the only parking in Boston where you pay a "Valet" charge, but you have to park your own car.
The "Valets" are just plain rude.
This is a pretty standard american thai place that is amazing for take out, though not the greatest atmosphere for dining in.
The pad thai was done well, relatively cheap and ready in 15 minutes, and comes in one of those cool plastic containers I hold on to bring lunch in the next few days.
But don't fill up too much because the meat is the best part.
My favorites are the flank steak and the house sirloin.
And they have my favorite dessert in the world; the bananas foster pie!

The ambiance here is one equivilant to stepping foot inside Carmen Electra and Dave Navarro's bar if they were still together with bull skulls hanging on the walls with red and black paint/tapestries.
Mango Margarita- 2/5 stars.
White Sangria- 3/5 stars: It tasted almost like water though towards the end.
I wish I had more room in my stomach for their happy hour food menu though.
The food here looked like it had a Southwestern twist to it.
Service has always been good and the coffee has been even better.
There's plenty of seating for kids, creaky old kneed people, and just about everyone else in between.
Update: just tried the tea today- it's also worthwhile.
Mary Chung seems to be a solid choice for Chinese food when you're out and about in Central.
The service was decent, again, nothing stellar, but nothing to really complain about.
We had the "Hot Platter" for an appetizer which is really just an assortment of friend things.
I had the Moo Shi Vegetable, which was definitely served with ample plum sauce and plenty of pancakes.
In the past I'd had their General Gau's chicken and it's definitely yummy.
Word of warning: Their spicy noodles (I think it's the dun dun noodles) are veeeeeeeery spicy.
I stood at the register bewildered.
I am standing at the register with the items I wish to purchase.
I bought my fiances engagement ring here back in February and proposed in April.
The amount of compliments she is still receiving on the ring is incredible.
Nice employees.
But prices seem a little over-priced
Everything about their fish and chips is wonderful!
The batter, the fish, the YUMMY tartar, and tasty fries.
Casual setting, good food, great drinks and nice band.
The small plates (tapas) were substantial.
Red snapper with coconut haberno sauce was as delightful as a dish served at the best upscale seafood restaurant.

aspectTerm.term: Red snapper with coconut haberno sauce

sentence.text: Grouper tacos were some of the best I've had.
As the guacamole queen (my family loves my homemade guac), I can say this was some of the best guac I've had.
My drink of choice was the Coco Loco, which did not disappoint.
Very pleasant dining at reasonable pricing.
Yak stew is good hearty one with strong herbal kick.
The marrow butter is Heaven.
Chocolate pudding is not bad but a bit starchy.
Although we didn't buy anything because the credenza we loved had a sold sticker on it, this store has better quality "vintage" items than other stores we had checked out in the area.
We went in when they were having a 20% off furniture sale and with that discount, the prices seemed very appropriate.
The worker was very nice when we asked a question about a piece.
I appreciate the cleanliness of the items.
The Rosemary bagels are fluffy and tasty and the fresh OJ is awesome!
Wouldn't go out of my way for this, but there's still a decent view here.
We ended up at the hummus cuisine austin food truck, I ordered the shawarma plate with tabouli and hummus.

aspectTerm.term: shawarma plate with tabouli and hummus

sentence.text: The owner told me it would be he best I would ever have and I have to say that so far it is the best Mediterranean cuisine I've had!
I was expecting much less for the price we paid, but my expectations were exceeded.
The staff was very friendly and the service was prompt.
I definitely recommend the bar and grille for superb service.
The rooms and pools went above expectations for the cost.
My only complaint is the breakfast buffet.
The food is awful and not worth the cost.
The sushi is good and the servers are friendly, even if the ambiance is lacking a bit.
You can get sushi of about equal quality at the nearby sushi counter known as Masa's Sushi Bar for half the price.
Sure, Bluefin has a larger menu, more choices and sometimes larger portions.
I like the lobster scrambler a lot!
The porched eggs are amazing!
Ground coffee is good too!
And orange juice is so fresh.
My boyfriend and I have tried the peanut butter burger and the bender burger.
One thing that I like is the bottomless fries!
The fries are really good, too.
My favorite thing about their menu is that you can order a half-size burger, which they call making it "girlie."
This miniature burger looked really small at first but it ended up being the perfect amount of food.
The only reason why I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5 is because our wait was SO LONG.
When we ordered our food, there was no line in front of us... we walked right up to the cashier.
After we sat down to wait, we waited for at least 30 minutes for our burgers to come out!
We did come during lunch time on a weekend, but the long wait will deter me from coming back here for a while.
The food was ok - nothing special.
I stayed for the Beer.
I told this to the main bar tender and he would not change it back, so I canceled my beer order and left.
A standout was the service.
John was exceptional and I will return to Babette's just because of his service.
The food was very good and the atmosphere was perfect.
Reservations were easy to make online and parking was valet.
The bathrooms are cool I guess.
The bottled and draft beer selection is great.
Great service!
We had mofongo, arepas con queso, bandeja de paisa dish with their chicharron, skirt steak, chorizo/blood sausage, pechuga de pollo con camarones.
Service was very nice.
The owners, Mustafa and Monica are wonderful, friendly people.

I also echo what others have said about service, I asked for something slightly custom and the cashier made a point to say that they don't usually do that, but she asked the sandwich-maker and they both said "OK".
Ten minutes later (yes, that's the standard wait time) my number comes up, and it's a regular sub not my custom sub!
It was nice to nosh on, but I'll admit I'm not enamored of fried foo.
And while the Moo Shi Vegetable was tasty, I did find myself wishing I'd ordered it with some meat.
Really good food and service (by the owner and his wife is the cook)
Arctic Char has good texture but less flavor and mysteriously whitish than normal.
Apple tart was cold, but i will give it a pass.
Again, all other food on site was great, but I would skip the breakfast.
Not a big fan of the whole wheat pancakes.
Both were pretty good, but the Peanut Butter burger was definitely the better one!
Glad we were recommended this place - food has some really good flavor!
They do a great job with everything from dry cleaning, to comforters, to drop off laundry and the prices are very reasonable.
Everything is spotless, never broken and the dry cleaning is always back on time and when you need it.
The service is prompt, though if you're ordering in the middle of the day, call your order in.
Hmmm...I've gone there for a slice, which is decent, the fish and chips were surprisingly good--not too saturated with grease, and the fries were crispy and not coated (yes!
and I've also had a burger.
Again, don't try to get fancy with it--all burgers are cooked well done.
The cold subs are also good (and they have smoked turkey, which is a nice option).
Super owners who have been there forever and who have the requisite sense of humor required to run a business in these parts.
Then as I was checking out, the two gals at the front desk were helping me and they were just as nice and talkative.
Not to mention the company itself has many locations and they are usually very clean.
This location in particular seems newer and cleaner than more.
It has a little kiureg for free coffee in the waiting room too.
Prices are very good for shoes and games, and the food is good.
I do have several issues, the service at times is not very good, and if you interested in drinking, I would suggest buying at the bar.
The owner is a great guy, friendly and knows how to treat customers with respect.
When we pulled up at about 8:45 there was only a single car there, which belonged to an employee.
Once inside it was a nifty place - arcade games, skee ball, air hockey, crane machines, etc.
The mini golf course is lit with black lights and all of the paint glows.
The monster theme is cute and they have a couple of animatonic monsters that are fun.
Even though the course is almost completely flat it was still pretty challenging.
A round of golf here will run you about $7.50.
The A/C seemed to be on, but it was not keeping the place cool.
The course was challenging and they did a great job painting and making the place look good.
It is obvious that someone put a lot of effort into designing the course and the monsters.
I would go to Monster Mini Golf again, because, with the exception of the heat I really enjoyed it...but based on their terrible location I will be surprised if they will be able to survive here.
The jerk wings omg!!!!!!!
I got here at around 8 so there were plenty of tables.
service was a tad bit slow because their were only two servers for the whole place, prob not smart.
Amazing food!
The Jerk chicken was amazing, the curry chicken, plantains, cabbage, peas and rice, and the oxtail dinner all cooked to perfection.
If you Want a burst of great Flavor and fulfilling food.
I've never had a problem with any missing pieces or parts, and I've bought a lot of Ikea furniture over the past 6 years or so.
I currently have 3 bookcases, a chair/footrest, and 3 different side tables from Ikea.
I used to have a very large, sturdy, and practical coffee table that I got from Ikea, but it was just too large for my new apartment so I had to get rid of it.
ONE problem, though, as far as furniture quality is concerned...
Pillows, candles, picture frames, wrapping paper .. Love them!
I finally tried their food for the first time last weekend, and YUCK!
I had a buffalo chicken wrap and some mac & cheese, and Colleen B. had the famous Swedish Meatballs with mac & cheese.
Mine was very good, and I tasted her meatballs ... not so much!
Needed a pedicure asap and decided to stop here.
They have a good variety of colors to choose from mostly OPI and China Glaze.
Even though they were people here before me, the wait wasn't too long.
Don't know the name of the lady who did my pedicure but she did a good job, and was pleasant.
Also the price for a pedicure isn't bad.
Will be back for my next pedicure when I'm in the area.
Walked in, we ordered first at the counter and then found a place to sit.
Service was friendly.
Water and ketchup was self served.
They do bring the food to you though.
Good vibe.
I ordered the slider-sized Hawthorne burger $4.50 because I wanted to taste what the strawberry preserves was like on a burger.
It's a like it/hate it burger.
Friend ordered the full-sized Sellwood burger $9.50.
Both were yummy burgers.
The bacon hit the spot.
Sliders are pretty dang small, you would need to order two to be full.
We also ordered the PDX fries $3- not worth.
The loaded fries might seem worthwhile, but with that price, I'll just get another burger.
I'm hungry for another slider!
Tried the red velvet chicken and waffles and strawberry stuffed French toast.
The waffle didn't taste like red velvet but, the chicken was seasoned to perfection!!
Always good food.
Good beer.
Margherita pizza and Mariano pizza are delish.
I made an appointment at Inman Park Dentistry after getting recommendations from neighbors.
The staff was kind, gentle, and explained exactly what they were doing and why.
It was the best dentist appointment I've ever had!
They also have email and text appointment reminders, which is really handy.
They have a beautiful selection of neutrals and funky stuff and everything is high quality.

aspectTerm.term: selection of neutrals and funky stuff

sentence.text: The museum begins with the 1960 convention and election season.
There are some cool signs and television footage from the campaign.
You can even read the original text of his inauguration speech.

aspectTerm.term: original text of his inauguration speech

sentence.text: Got together with friends we hadn't seen in a very long time so we didn't make a huge deal about how bad our food was on Saturday night.
I ordered steak, medium rare, and it came out well done...
Waitress took it back to have it corrected and once again it came back well done.
I'm normally not a picky eater but honestly this steak was not edible.
I also ordered the mashed potatoes as a side.
This cute little restaurant is in my neighbourhood and I jumped to buy their 6 course menu for 2 on Living Social.
That is definitely not a good reputation to have, but I do agree that their portions are kind of small and you do need many dishes to be satisfied.
I thought they wanted this because I bet they changed the items that went on the menu to accommodate for the cheaper coupon.
This wasn't so as we were serve exactly what was on the chalkboard wall for the 6 course taster - except for the dessert which apparently they ran out of.
Avocado could have been more ripe, which would have added better richness and sweetness.
Truffle flavour was there in the rice, but not amazing.
4th course was the fish - a tiny piece, but it was simply seared with a crispy skin.
Accompaniments weren't memorable.
The rhubarb sauce was yummy nonetheless, although again the rice was hard and it felt like it had been in the fridge for a while.
Shared a pitcher of sangria for 17 bucks and that was quite yummy, although it was quite watery.
yes, but I wish the delicious food was actually made fresh and served at a good temperature!
Highly recommend the bacon wrapped dolmas.
Octopus is tender, tuna and salmon full of flavor and cooked just right.
Always good to see a place where the employees are happy and the wait is short.
Went to this place for Lunch.
The tacos were super good and so was the service.
The rice was amazing too.
The car received was a very very worn bare-boned Jeep Patriot.
The interior was in bad shape, the brakes squeaked constantly and the car's ride was terrible.
My concern is why would a car of this poor safety and quality ever be rented by a company like Avis.
I absolutely love their coffee and their staff is always friendly.
Parking can be difficult during peak hours though!
This place serves THE BEST Chinese style Ramen in town!
And the soups usually have various veggies in them, but always have broccoli rabe, my fave!
Try the duck orthe BBQ sliced pork with your ramen - it is AMAZING and really hits the spot!
Also this locale serves boba smoothies and drinks, and iced milk tea, which I love to get for dessert!
I loved the registry they had because I could add other website/links on the registry.
Now with our second child still going to Posh for outfits and those hard to find things like "the snot sucker".
Not to mention that a mani is only $10 here compared to the $12 everywhere else in Boston.
You get a free mani after 10 visits.
The menu was awesome - I mean where else can you find a side of gyro for breakfast?
The blueberry pancakes were enormous!
The sausage wasn't anything more than regular sausage links and though the home fries looked like they would be delicious, they just tasted like potatoes.
Crystal, our waitress, was phenomenal.
Our breakfast was exceptional.
We ordered the Reece's Pieces Pancakes with bacon, the Jack Daniel's omelette and the Steak and Cheese Omelette.
For sides we chose the fresh fruit cup, sweet potato hash and home fries.
You will not find a more welcoming diner with staff that is cheery in the early morning while offering exceptional and unique breakfast choices.
Thanks for starting this day off with a great breakfast and a smile
Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Their organic sodas were also a lot of fun to try!
My heart beats a steady rhythm for this location in particular.
Not only because they serve some of the best ice cream in the world, but because it's a location that works with youth to give the their first work experience.
The ice cream is magic.
Get something from the Flavor Graveyard like Blueberry Cheesecake or Rainforest Crunch.
I'm surprised how overly sugary a lot of their donuts are.
The prices are very affordable and you will not find better quality for the price in Boston, guaranteed.
I had a normal cleaning appointment a couple days ago and I had the nicest hygienist nurse, nicest and charming doctor who came and chatted with me when I had a random question during.
Nothing out of this world, basic pub/sports bar food, the chicken fingers and fries are good, as is the combo platter.
Great entertainment and the interior was decorated very nicely with urban artwork.
Food came out in a timely manner.
The salesperson was really helpful.
Agree with past reviews that food does not come out hot! :(
Sous vide chicken was barely palatable at room temperature.
The gazpacho was amazing tasting, although points off for messy presentation.
Their rice was too bland.
Seafood is always cooked perfectly.
Plenty of tasty food for a great price.
Susan was more than happy to do a manicure, eyebrow, and lip wax!
Husband ordered the blueberry pancakes with side sausage and I went with the bacon egg and cheese on a bagel.

aspectTerm.term: bacon egg and cheese on a bagel

sentence.text: My bacon egg and cheese was good, not punch you in the face good, but it was just a classic bacon egg and cheese.
Though I do wish there were more flavorful ice creams.
The best spot to people watch.. it's esp fun in South End bc of the fashionable gay community.
My waiters at the cafe were so fabulous with their nails painted, i loved it so much!
even the bathroom is clean and unique looking.
The servers are very attentive, the menu is extensive and the food is really good.
Great atmosphere and I like that the bar is tucked away from the restaurant.
Very good food and fun atmosphere.
This place is BUSY on Friday nights...we checked in at 7pm (after the usual dinner rush) and still had to wait 20 minutes...so make a reservation if you can!
Also, their parking lot is tiny, so be prepared to walk a block or two once you find street parking.
They are situated in a great location that makes it easily accessible too.
We were there pretty early in the night so there wasnt a lot of people, but the lay out can handle quite a few people.
The bartenders were nice and the drinks were great for the price.
We stopped in for breakfast this morning.
Mine had bacon and jalapenos.
There are a small number of seats inside and some tables out on the sidewalk.
They have espresso drinks and gelato.
A sign on the door boasts free wifi.
I travel often for work and I know Bindi is under the best care with Allegra and her assistant Haley.
PCM connects to the Atlanta Beltline, so when it's no longer 3000 degrees outside, you can take your buttery gelato on a stroll.
I went here for an express mani-pedi and I wasn't all that impressed.
Call me cheap, but this service is overpriced and I think I'll continue going to a place down the street in a shopping center.
The express mani-pedi took over an hour (which is stated on the website) but I feel like it took this long because things were done in slow motion, not because of the number of services given.
And the warm lotion wasn't so warm, but just a runny mess and the woman ended up wiping off with rough, dry towel.
The basic foot filing is also a joke.
I am giving this review two stars because I have always gotten good service from Checker Cab via "Taxi Magic" in the past.
I then used the online booking tool that allowed me to book a cab.
Tried the red velvet tonight and it was very good.
The broth is so good and there's so much tofu it's a very filling meal.
I've seen some of the sizzling kalbi go by and it looks and smells amazing, but I can't seem to get myself to order anything other than the soup.
I've had the kimchi soup and that was good.
The seafood soup was good, but pretty skimpy on the seafood.
I also love the fresh egg that comes along side the meal.
There really is no ambiance.
It's got a rather dull interior to be honest.
They put their time and effort where it counts - in the food!
His rates are very reasonable!
Amazing place to chow down on something new, Fried Okras were AMAZING!
and the fried chicken with country gravy and habanero jam AMAZING!!!!

aspectTerm.term: fried chicken with country gravy and habanero jam

sentence.text: Less variety of food but timely service.
Chicken express employees decided to squeeze all of this food into one small food box - meant for one person.
I'm allergic to okra and there was so little room in the food box that my biscuit was completely smashed by the side of okra.
The roof top view is of the amazing Austin's skyline.
I love the Liege waffles.
Her's had pana cotta and strawberries on top.
I wolfed my waffle down in seconds flat and was seriously thinking about getting a sweet one for dessert.
We shared 2 scoops of the Nutella gelato.
Also...great location - easily accessible.
The staff was nice, including the woman doing my mani-pedi so if anything that is what would bring me back for another round.
Been to this place 2-3 times already and each time I've gotten the soft tofu soup.
The head-on shrimp had a great broth, but too much work to eat.
And to top it off, the service is really friendly, too.
I had the beef stew with the French bread and the French bread was awesome.
It was the three soup hot pot that caught my attention.
Despite what I've read, the service was decent.
Our server spoke both Chinese and English.
The menu is priced just under $21 with a listing of items available to order.
Veggies - decent selection good quality, Meat slices - not much good.
Lamb was the exception and was thicker and not frozen.
Vegetarian options are good, but not the Vegan options.
I love the amazeballs staff.
My first Ethiopian food experience, and surely not my last.
I had no idea what I was doing, but the menu was very accessible to a rookie and the staff was happy to offer recommendations.
I recommend the tibs with shiro and injera.
Quick, efficient service .... awesome that it is within walking distance and they are open late-ish (6pm?)
They said it was really good, we had reservations, got seated, our waiter seemed to be disinterested, we got the food and honestly it was below average.
Left unsatisfied with the food for the huge price.
Food is 3/5 stars, poor service knocks it down to 2.
Healthy, fresh, flavorful combinations or make your own salads.
Fresh real juice!
Really friendly employees!
I went on their website and picked out an arrangement and called to place the order for the ripe arrangement.
The arrangement came and the design work was horried.
It looked nothing like the arrangement online and all the flowers were cut short like an amature had made this.
I called Twig on Monday when the flowers were delivered on Saturday to express my disappointment and concern.
I spoke to a sales girl who said she would pass my information onto a manager and someone would call me back.
I will never order from Twig again and feel they are extremely unprofessional and need to hire more experienced designers.
I think the worst part was sitting at a bar being served by a bartender with no personality and little bar knowledge.
For Christ sakes, if you don't know how to make a martini, look it up, or don't be a bartender.
Other than that, decently priced food, lots of tv's!
Short, but nice golf course in Newton.
Was in drinking some great drink specials, decided to try the 2 for 1 entree special, was excellent!
Nice dinner, great prices and worth a visit
Now the new branch is open, and all three ATMs are not working.
Also they have so many more choices on the menu which was refreshing to see.
Scallops were cooked perfectly, definitely fresh
I hate to write a poor review because the employees at this branch are wonderful - and they deserve five stars.
The food is fine.
And cocktails are great (hence 3.5 total stars).
Cute ambiance.
However it's pretty small and the parking lot is tiny.
Be prepared to wait in line for 30+ minutes for a parking spot on weekends.
So happy with the services of these ladies!
Would definitely recommend AJ's to any potential brides looking for pro services.
I asked for help on the sides and the stylist asked me what size do I want, and then proceeded to botch the job.
My haircut looks like it was by a blind man with a weed wacker.
The ice cream here is amazing!
But the employees behind the counter were so high that I had to tell them my order multiple times and had to watch them clumsily out my order together.
I'd come back for the ice cream, not the service.
I love their food.
The burgers are consistent and VERY flavorful.
Their fries are truly epic and of course, those shakes are a must.
The apple cider fritters were heavenly and so were the blueberry bourbon Basil .
I ordered three junior hamburgers and a large fries at the drive-thru.
I get up to the window, get my order, and discover the fries are rather overcooked.
The replacement fries were on the edge of being overcooked.
And Katz, he makes a good bagel.
I just came back from this place today, I was excited to try the food after it was recommended to me by a coworker.
The Jerk Chicken was bland, as if was made to be served in a nursing home.
The plantains were hard and the rice tasted like to much cinnamon was added to it.
With this quality of the food that they are serving and their high price this shouldn't last.
We had an overall nice experience, and felt that the food was cooked with integrity (my steak was delicious).
The service was a little sloppy, as the waitress did not build rapport or romance the menu.
Based on the quality of service I would not classify this as fine dining, but casual dining.
I just finished an excellent lunch at Ming Court.
The service by Joe was exceptional and the meal was delicious.
I had the Chinese broccoli, shrimp dim sum and a tuna roll.
Chase, the chef, was so friendly and easy to talk to.
He gave me a quick introduction about the food.
The technician had great bedside manner, and made the experience as pleasurable as it could have been.
Scheduling was kept on time, and there was ample free parking.
Overall great experience, and professional staff.
The gentlemen behind the counter were not only helpful, but absolutely hilarious.
Solid joint with pretty excellent BBQ.
Within 2 days half of the lilacs died.
Jerk Chicken is supposed to be spicy not sweet as it was served here.
Very disappointed, especially for food of cost $13.50.
So if you want great BBQ without the line, this is your place.
Beef Rib is massive.
Sides - you serve yourself - and all of them are delightful.
Brisket is - not amazing, but really darn good.
Pork ribs are really solid.
Sausage is a go-to as well.
the food was good, though they were busy so the service was a little slow.
but it was nice to sit inside and have a nice meal in the middle of an amusement park.
we also didn't have reservations, but we only had to wait a few minutes to be seated.
the green beans were yummy and the curry i had was delicious.
The viet/mexican cuisine is definitely an interesting combo but it works!
I got the banh mi sandwich and it was awesome!
Got some Kim Chi Fries and it was the bomb!
I would definitely recommend this place to come to if you want some good food for lunch or some breakfast tacos.
Not a lot of room to move around with chairs and tables but this is definitely great lunch spot!
They're nice enough here, and they sell some nice looking furniture, but i question the quality.
Years ago I purchased a leather sectional couch here for approx $4,000.
Luckily it was under warranty.
So the 5 year warranty was totally useless.
The restaurant was clean, the staff was friendly, the food was fresh and good and it was surprisingly affordable.
Bonus: they had TVs tuned to the Pats game so I even got to watch some football.
I had the colorado lamb pasta preceded by a baby arugula salad.
Our server was very nice and it was, overall, a great experience.
Excellent dosas, service extremely slow and staff inattentive.
Waited 55 minutes to get our food when other tables who entered much later than us received their food.
High rating on food, need to address their service skills.
The atmosphere was nice, the service was friendly, but the food is not authentic and not very good.
The food has gone downhill and cheap over the past year.
Wonderful food, great prices!
Happy hour skinny drink with upside down beer was awesome!!
Not only was the food top notch, Mia and Duncan provided superb service.
Must try if you love hot pot.
Well for starters the seats were horrible.
I thought the seat I sat in was broken, but trying out a couple others in the row I was sitting in, they seem to be all bad.
If going be prepared for seats that are not comfortable.
Our view was amazing and I enjoyed being able to sit or stand whenever I felt like it.
They have a bar that serves some food in the basement.
My only complaint is that acoustics weren't the best -- I think because we were behind the speakers.
It won't deter me from coming back for future shows, I'll just choose my seats a little more wisely now that I know.
The ham and cheese omelet was delicious and better than I expected.
Hashbrowns were delicious and I enjoyed the little taste of fruit to go with my meal.
It's a small space but would definitely be great to enjoy the patio during a nice day.
My only complaint was there's no parking lot and it seems a lot of the neighborhood parks on the street, but definitely will be back!
She had the burger special, I had the shepherd's pie.
I've been coming here for years and they have always been helpful but the workers today are especially nasty!
I love the weekday crew compared to these grumblers.
Boo on the barista and boo on the lady at the register.
Had the fish sandwich and fish tacos.
The staff was friendly and personable.
The food is, by and large, less deserving of its price.
The seating is great for groups though the lighting is a little too subdued for my taste.
If you're looking for wine with less regard for food, Cru is a great choice for you.
However, the staff was friendly enough so I decided to return to get my cavities filled, since I honestly just wasn't sure where else to go.
Wish they had the more traditional food one but it's ok it was still delicious!
We had a nice, filling meal for less than I would have paid at McDonalds.
I was struck by how tasty the salad was and the pasta was just right.
Minus one star for a mediocre martini and a not as cozy as the menu deserves atmosphere.
The best part was the white sangria - that was tasty!
I ordered there so called "jumbo wings" and they were smaller than the buffalo wild wings.
On a second occasion I ordered a steak sandwich - the bun weighed more than the amount of meat.
Finally, on another occasion I ordered the nachos.
The food is not inexpensive and you would not expect this bad quality.
After that initial cleaning, all of my other visits have been with the awesome Dr. Hura, whom I cannot gush over enough.
My cleaning ended up turning into a few cavities and a root canal, but I never dread my visits with Dr. Hura.
His assistants are dolls, too.
And lastly, one quick note about the office manager, Jennifer.
However, she talked to me about a payment plan for my root canal, allowed me to pay it in parts, and was just a sweetie to deal with.
Well... fast forward one year later and I decided to try their burgers based on the reviews - not a great idea.
Veteran bartenders.
Quality food.
I almost always get the bibimbap, and sometimes with tofu soup, as well.
The banchan is usually good.
The service is decent.
The ambiance is minimal.
We ordered the Egg Salad sandwich and it was brilliant.
Will be back to try the crepes.
Seating available indoors and out.
I had some good crabcakes, and one of the better turkey burgers I've ever had.
My gf got a salad that had radicchio in it and was mentioning to me a very normal volume that the salad was mediocre when I asked how it was.
I called and the company sent out a representative to examine the couch.
Interestingly, my wife's reaction was exactly the same - she was surprised by how good her caesar salad was and her pasta was great!
I'll definitely be returning to the office for my other dental work, and would recommend it to a friend.
He also does make a mean sandwich!
Beers are cheap, food is pretty good.
The manager, who was apparently eavesdropping on our conversation, proceeded to come over to the table and tell us that he couldn't help but overhear that she didn't like the salad.
He explained that radicchio is a "acquired taste", then came back a second time when we were done with this course and accused my girlfriend of just pushing it around her plate and not eating it.
Anyway, it was a bit too intrusive and my gf was worried about what she said for the rest of dinner lest the manager come back and say he overheard something.
This place is the great place to shop if you always wanted to get clothing, assesories, etc at a cheaper price.
And I also love that the color featured for the week is 50% off, which beats the regular price.
Flip has got the best upscale burger I've had yet.
Marissa, our waiter, was excellent.
The waiter talked the newbies through the menu, even talked us into a "Southern Long Island Tea" and came back regularly to ensure we had everything we needed.
I had the lamb burger medium rare.
Others tried various hamburgers, a trio of three sliders, fries (crispy) , sweet potato tots (not as good as the fries) and salads.
Beautiful setting.
The patio area is great for a date night!
We ordered truffle fries and shishito peppers and were not impressed.
We also ordered cocktails which were very watered down.. We left after one round.
Service was good.
The waitress made sure to come around often.
The food is awesome.
Probably one of the best sushi places for the price.
Quality is high, taste is delicious, size is smaller but I rather have quality over quantity.
There is only the owner that is making the sushi and one waitress.
When it's packed, it can be a little slow but like other great places, there is a wait for the food.
They had amazing handmade guacamole that you could watch being made right by your table.
Our food plate was enormous and I couldn't even eat it all.
My fajita was great and I liked the refried beans.
Our waiter was really nice and very friendly.
The veggies were so good.
The falafel was made right then and there and very tasty with the sauce it came with.
The fries were so good I even ate the tiny pieces.
Last minute I decided to get a small hummus to go and I'm so glad I did!
None of my topping were cooked for some reason.
On my very first trip to Oregon as a tourist back in April, my friend, another Hawaii transplant, took me to Black Bear Diner for lunch.
The wait for a table was about 15 minutes because it was a lunch rush.
And because of this wait, I was going to be even more critical of their food than I already am.
We finally got seated and after looking through their big menu, I decided on the meat loaf.
The food came out fast considering how busy the place was.
Suprisingly, the meat loaf was good!
Since moving here, I've eaten at Black Bear a few more times, trying different items from the menu.
Their breakfast menu is my favorite.
I get the meat lovers omelette with hash and pancakes.
They serve very large portions.
It has everything from breakfast to dessert so you'll always find something to feed your hunger.
The place is clean, prices fair, and service is good.
Wicked good pizza very friendly and cute staff, definitely coming back after stopping in on a whim
We arrived to the brewery, parking was a bit hectic, and were able to get on a tour of the brewery within minutes of arriving.
The waiting hall had lots of different information and historical references available in regards to the brewery.
Not only was the tour free with the request of donations for local charities, but the tour was extremely educational.
I felt like an experienced beer maker after the tour was over.
The tasting was amazing.
Service was quick.
Server was awesome, prices a bit high but lovely variety of shrimp.
Lobster tail was yummy!
Corn fritters were a yummy hit and more of a dessert as not very corny lol
Excellent food and great service; shout out to our server Xavier; this is authentic Mexican food; fajitas mixta was excellent.
This place is where local Mexicans go for Mexican food - that's got to be good.
The employees at the counter were very nice, however the dental assistant was a ghetto mess.
The dentist then suggested I get a root canal, and my teeth are in no condition to need a surgery like that, so I told him I would not be doing that procedure that day.
Oh, and the computers were filthy with dust... scares me as to the cleanliness of the tray of the facility.
Metropolis has the best customer service - hands down.
They get points for serving complimentary chilled tea.
Unfortunately the food here did not impress me.
We ordered pho and the seafood soup.
The Pho was south of OK.
It was not the most flavorful pho we'd had and the noodles were a bit under-cooked.
The view of Cambridge is absolutely beautiful.
The service is excellent.
The employees are responsive to your questions and requests.
The rooms are spacious and able to accommodate groups of travelers.
The beds are also quite comfortable.
The location is very convenient.
What a delicious meal!
We haven't been to Gallo Nero since it was renovated and the interior is so much nicer!
Gallo Nero now has a full liquor license and an expanded menu that came along with the renovations, both pluses.
Our waitress was super friendly and helped to make our dining experience positive.

Initially, we were served dinner rolls which were toasted and nothing too special, except the house made garlic olive oil they serve with the bread is so delicious, you want to keep eating more and more!
I started with the homemade chicken lemon rice soup ($2.50) which was nice and hearty, containing lots of rice and white meat chicken.
We also ordered the Roasted Eggplant Ravioli Alla Margarita ($13.29) which came with a salad of our choice.
The ravioli was served to us steaming hot, fresh out of the kitchen!
The waitress was able to sell us on the cannoli for dessert as soon as she told us the filling is homemade.
The deviled eggs are great, but the tacos really steal the show.
Great service, friendly staff, ample and comfortable seating, food better than average although some items could use refinement.
Nice local establishment, party-friendly, and cool solar power on roof.
Try the pizza bread bowl at lunch, great lunch specials at great prices.
Twilight Zone calzone also gigantic and delicious.
The only disappointment was the Krispy Kreme milkshake.
They give you a needless stream of chips and salsa which were amazing.
When the tour started, we were pleasantly surprised.
This place seems a little stingier than others when it comes to the amount of food as well.
The Seafood soup was mostly flavourless.
The soup had one tiny, TINY piece of squid in it.
There is a large bar that was completely packed when we got there.
We ordered the Caesar salad.
The pasta was perfectly al dente.
Great food, tastes very authentic.
Friendly service.
Good atmosphere.
The pad thai is the best I've ever had.
I expected great donuts and great selection (Donut King).
Good service.
Expensive donuts that taste like Dunkin Donuts.
Tasty sauces.
We gave the coupon to our server right when we sat down.
If you like dealing with used car salesman this is a great place to go!
We were the only ones there, asked for recommendations, and opted to order take-out.
We focused on the "meat" dishes.
The food all tasted the same -- and not good at that.
Kinda like they used the same sauce for everything with just very minor alterations.
Very simple menu.
The hotdog was very plump like braatwurst.
Enjoyed the tap room.
Lots of interesting flavors mixed into their beers for craft brew week, like coco puffs stout!
Great food and drinks.
Good atmosphere and friendly staff.
Had the French dip prime rib which was amazing.
It is buffet style, where you walk up and select a meat and two sides.
The meat options were Salisbury steak, ribs, fried chicken, baked chicken, and more.
The side options were the classic southern fare.
Collard greens, fried okra, mac and cheese, corn bread, etc.
The price was also pretty good.
Only 9.50 for a huge serving of ribs, mac and cheese, and fried okra.
Add 1.50 for the delicious sweet tea, and it makes it a Great meal for the money.
How can I be expected to enjoy my Southwestern cuisine without a proper greeting?
The staff was not very friendly and all three seemed to have a serious case of the mumbles making assembling my meal rather difficult.
I always get the burrito in a bowl.
The softness of the burrito itself getting stuck to the roof of my mouth is really unappealing so I prefer the burrito in a bowl eaten with chips.
Of the burrito assembly line restaurants sweeping the nation, Moe's chips are a little below average for me.
The guac and queso are always pretty good and the salsa bar is acceptable once you stir up the stagnant salsas a bit.
Three stars for being a Moe's with grouchy employees.
