Yes, the outside of the pink painted restaurant is deteriorating and the inside resembles a washed-up border town cafeteria but, appearances aside this place is AWESOME!
They offer an array of tacos (they're open for breakfast and lunch only) on a cash only basis (no debit cards).
Prices are on the CHEAP at $1.30 to $1.89 per taco!
Piece of advice: Beware of the flies if you eat-in.
The price is a bit on a pricy side for the food they serve.
Though, I had their lunch special before and it is reasonable.
I recommend the crunch roll and chicken teriyaki lunch box.
Went for lunch today.
Best wings I ever had.
Nice atmosphere and a ton of tvs to watch games.
They have good appetizer specials as well.
The meat is succulent, and the Mediterranean spices tickle my fancy like watching Liz Taylor play Cleopatra.
My husband and I stopped by for a 'nibble and sip' while window shopping on a Sunday afternoon and had a lovely time!
We also had the classic cheese flight and the steam mussels, both were delish.
Many of my friends come to this place on a weekly basis, and when the sun is shining and the weather calls for patio dining, Parish Cafe is a nice location.
The beer selection is decent, the salads are large and not-so-in-charge.
The Zuni roll is definitely a craving that I get at least once a month so I basically just get the same thing whenever I visit.
While the food is nothing spectacular, I really like Parish for more nostalgic reasons.
I've had some great memories there and their Zuni roll does the job.
Been here for lunch and dinner and love it!
Service was lacking one time but I think it was a fluke thing.
Beautiful restaurant with a nice patio.
Bustles and is a bit loud at peak times but the food is beautifully presented and delicious.
Damn good Sandwich (Porchetta) .
We ordered it take-away for the Plane ride back to Honolulu.
We noticed Meat & Bread as we were walking back from Nuba where we had a really good lunch.
Best Mongolian beef in the town!
Nice service, neat environment~ friendly staff!

Stopped in for lunch with 2 friends, and we were extremely satisfied with what we got.
Our server came right away and poured water for us while asking if we wanted anything else to drink.
He kindly explained the menu and was very attentive for the duration of our meal.
My friends and I ordered different variations of the lunch special, so we could share and try a bit of everything.

The JFK Presidential Library & Museum is a great for reliving the highlights of Kennedy's presidency.
Nothing negative about Kennedy was on display, which is unusual for a presidential museum.
Overall, the museum is certainly worth visiting, but there is certainly room for improvement.
However, it isn't nearly as comprehensive as other presidential museums.
Given the Kennedy legacy, I expected more stories and items.
There was very little mentioning of JFK's childhood, his relationship with Jackie, his children, or his Congressional career.

Knowing how quick they go, I wisely made it a point for this to be the first stop of the day, for a very healthy breakfast.
Not so wisely, we ended up getting a beastly 4 donuts for the 2 of us, which is not advisable before a big lunch.
The yeast donuts are the way to go, and they were all great.

In the past I've only had their fries with my meal and they never came out this hot or delicious.

The steak was well seasoned and extremely flavorful.

Service was friendly and very attentive.
The kids liked sitting in the booth with their shoes off.
Excellent bar service with a variety of cocktails, good food, and fun atmosphere ..
So, this place might actually have the best food in Vancouver.

I partly chalk it up to it being more cafe than restaurant, but also putting out high quality food with meticulous preparation.
Food took about 20 minutes to come out, but it was definitely worth the wait.
We had the Zucchini Pasta and Marinated Portobello Mushroom Steak with pesto sauce (next time I might try marinara) and the Fresh Addiction Burger.

i will be making a complaint against This store and the Manager.

I wished the rolls would have been warmer so that the butter melted when spread.

The crabcake was very well made.
I finished off with the softserve ice cream swirl with a dusting of a peanut butter topping.

I wish I would have thought to ask for a to-go container for the ice cream I couldn't finish!
I should never have opened their door.
Just a few minutes in my initial consult, she completely gained my confidence and I could sense her genuineness in the aim of achieving the look exactly how I had it in my mind.
Bad ass sandwiches, great service, quick customer flow, friendly staff, clean, modern, bright.
The portions were just right, the presentation was perfect and the sandwiches were delicious.
Didn't feel cramped inside, the preparation was very visual and engaging, and the decor is interesting and clever.
The staff is generally nice.
The martinis were great.

The calimari had a cornmeal breading that made it crunchy.
The Carolina BBQ glaze was critusy and had a bit of a kick.
I had the carbonara.
My friend had the burger and fries.
This time I got the detox shot and the queen green smoothie, and definitely felt refreshed and recharged.
Don't waste your time unless you want to be in an immature environment where you wait 30 minutes to get a drink and risk getting stabbed.
The prices are probably a little higher than most places, a pint is closer to $6 but I do like that have 3 sizes you can choose from.
Service was horrible...
The employee who did the gommage was very nice and made you feel completely comfortable even though you're naked.
Recently, I was in the area, used Yelp because I wanted a dessert.
Cream puffs, bread, Danish cupcakes, etc.
Great date place, but also a good place to go with friends and gab for a few hours over drinks, while lounging against comfy pillows.
The menu doesn't have a ton of options, but the middle-eastern style food that is served is yummy.
They have been serving Russian food and groceries for 17 years but this was our first visit.
The menu represents Russian classics and everything tastes as if your Russian Bubbi prepared it but better.
If you decide to go with the crapes the portion size is huge and they are extremely filling, we share those and the blintzes and we could not finish the crepes.
We got the Orlando morning crpe with pesto, which was a great finish.
Definitely interested in returning and trying the green borscht and a few of their salads.
There Piroshky look like a plate of heaven.
Service was very friendly and knowledgeable
We always have breakfast items but they had lunch and loved it.
Before we left we tried dessert and it was the perfect way to top it all off.
My step dad said they have the best priced mimosas too!
Can't beat a $3 mimosas!
Plus the owner is always kind and helpful.
The staff is always on their 'A' game as well.
Really attentive wait staff, wonderful food!
Loved the balsamic dressing on the house salad.
Pasta carbonara was delicious too!
The red sangria was also a hit!
Best vegan cheese we've had and the cheese boards are fabulous!
Location is very small, arrive early for lunch.
Service was attentive
The service is very good, mainly because of the fact that they have a button system where if you need anything then you press it and they will come.
I ordered the kimchi sundoboo and spicy pork combination.

sentence.text: The wait staff was nice and cheerful.

I'm shocked by the rave reviews on the food.
They call it "elevated" low country, and setting aside the contradiction, it seems like "elevated" to them means only that the food is low on flavor and offered in itsy bitsy portions.
First, I love, love, love hushpuppies, but the hushpuppies were meh.
Totally outrageous for black eyed peas and rice, and not nearly as well-cooked or deep in flavor as the real version you get down south in a big bowl for $2.
Worse was the Frogmore Stew (low country boil).
I love a good frogmore stew, but this was just awful, and absolute highway robbery.
When it arrived, there was so little food that it was like a terrible joke.
In the end, we left hungry and unsatisfied, and also thirsty, as all the food was overly salted (and I'm a huge lover of sodium).
The frustrating thing was seeing the kitchen folks just going at their own pace with no sense of urgency.
At least advise of possibly long wait time and give the option to wander off for a coffee if they know it's going to take so long to complete the order.
